div1.head: λᾶας
div1.etym: a gen. λάου in Soph. as if λᾶας was of first decl.
div1.sense: Lat. lapis, a stone, Hom., etc.

div1.head: λαβή
div1.sense: the part intended for grasping, a handle, haft, Dem.; λαβαὶ ἀμφίστομοι of a cup, Soph.
as a pugilistic term, a grip or hold, ὥσπερ ἀθλητὴς λαβὴν ζητεῖν Plut.:—metaph. a handle, occasion, opportunity, λαβὴν διδόναι, Lat. ausam praebere, Ar.; so, λ. παραδιδόναι, παρέχειν Ar., Plat.

div1.head: λαβραγόρης
div1.sense: a bold, rash talker, braggart, Il.

div1.head: λάβραξ
div1.sense: a ravenous sea-fish, perh. the bass, Ar.

div1.head: λαβρεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to talk rashly, brag, Il.

div1.head: λαβροπόδης
div1.sense: rapid of foot, rushing, Anth.

div1.head: λαβροποτέω
div1.sense: to drink hard, Anth.

div1.head: λάβρος
div1.sense: Hom. of wind, rain, etc., furious, boisterous, Hdt.; λ. πῦρ, κύματα, πόντος, etc., Eur.
after Hom., of men, boisterous, turbulent, violent, Theogn., Soph., etc.
greedy, Pind., Eur.
adv. λάβρως, violently, furiously, Theogn.
greedily, Aesch.

div1.head: λαβροσύνη
div1.sense: violence, greed, Anth.

div1.head: λαβρόσυτος
div1.sense: rushing furiously, Aesch.

div1.head: λαβύρινθος
div1.sense: a labyrinth or maze, a building consisting of halls connected by tortuous passages, Hdt.
any spiral body, as a snail, Anth.; ἐκ σχοίνων λαβ. a bow-net of rushes, Theocr.

div1.head: λαγαρίζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be slack or gaunt through hunger, to starve, Ar.; λαγαρόομαι, Pass. to be or become slack: of frozen water, to be in the act of thawing, Anth.

div1.head: λαγαρός
div1.sense: slack, hollow, sunken, of the flanks, Xen.:— κατὰ τὸ λαγαρώτατον in the least defensible part, Plut.
slack, loose, pliant, Xen.

div1.head: λαγέτας
div1.sense: leader of the people, Pind.

div1.head: λάγινος
div1.sense: of the hare, Aesch.

div1.head: λάγιον
div1.sense: a leveret, Xen.

div1.head: λαγνεία
div1.sense: lasciviousness, lust, Xen.

div1.head: λάγνος
div1.sense: lascivious, lustful, Arist.

div1.head: λαγοδαίτης
div1.sense: hare-devourer, Aesch.

div1.head: λαγοθήρας
div1.sense: a hare-hunter, Anth.

div1.head: λαγοκτονέω
div1.sense: to kill hares, Anth.

div1.head: λάγυνος
div1.sense: a flask, flagon, Lat. lagena, Anth., etc.

div1.head: λαγχάνω
div1.sense: c.acc. to obtain by lot, by fate, by the will of the gods, Hom.; with inf. added, ἔλαχον πολιὴν ἅλα ναιέμεν I had the sea for my portion to dwell in, says Poseidon, Il.; ἔλαχʼ ἄναξ δούλην σʼ ἔχειν Eur.:—of the genius presiding over oneʼs life, ἐμὲ μὲν Κὴρ λάχε Il.; esp. in perf. to be the tutelary deity of a place, to protect it, θεοῖσιν, οἳ Περσίδα γῆν λελόγχασι Hdt.:—absol., πρὸς Θύμβρης ἔλαχον Λύκιοι had their post assigned near Thymbra, Il.

of public officers, to obtain an office by lot (v. κύαμος ΙΙ) ; ἀρχὴν λαχεῖν, opp. to χειροτονηθῆναι (to be elected), Ar.; so, c. inf., ὁ λαχὼν πολεμαρχέειν he who had the lot to be polemarch, Hdt.; οἱ λαχόντες βουλευταί (sc. εἶναι), Oratt.; and absol., οἱ λαχόντες those on whom the lot fell, Thuc.
as Attic law-term, λαγχάνειν δίκην to obtain leave to bring on a suit, Plat., Oratt.; and (without δίκην) λαγχάνειν τινι to bring an action against one, Oratt.
c. gen. partit. to get oneʼs share of, become possessed of, Hom., Attic
absol. to draw (i. e. obtain) the lot, Od.: cast lots, NTest.
Causal Epic redupl. aor. λέλαχον, to put in possession of a thing, πυρὸς λελαχεῖν τινα to grant one the right of funeral fire, Il.
intr. to fall to oneʼs lot or share, Od., Eur.

div1.head: λαγῴδιον
div1.sense: a leveret, Ar.

div1.head: λαγών
div1.sense: the hollow on each side below the ribs, the flank, Eur.; in pl. the flanks, Eur., Ar.
metaph. any hollow, Anth., Plut.

div1.head: λαγῷος
div1.sense: of the hare, Ar.:— τὰ λαγῷα (sc. κρέα) , hareʼs flesh, and, generally, dainties, delicacies, ζῆν ἐν πᾶσι λαγῴοις Ar.

div1.head: λαγώς
div1.sense: a hare, Lat. lepus, Hom., Aesch., etc.

div1.head: λαγωσφαγία
div1.sense: a killing of hares, Anth.

div1.head: λάδανον
div1.sense: an aromatic gum, gum mastich, Hdt.

div1.head: λαέρτης
div1.sense: a kind of ant: as pr. n. the father of Ulysses, Od.; also Λαέρτιος, ου, Λάρτιος, Soph.

div1.head: λάζομαι
div1.sense: to take, seize, grasp, Il.; ὀδὰξ λαζοίατο γαῖαν may they bite the dust, Il.; metaph., πάλιν δʼ ὅ γε λάζετο μῦθον he took back, i. e. altered his speech, Hom.
the form λάζυμαι occurs in Hhymn. and Eur.

div1.head: λαθητικός
div1.sense: likely to escape notice, Arist.

div1.head: λαθικηδής
div1.sense: banishing care, Il., Anth.

div1.head: λαθίπονος
div1.sense: forgetful of sorrow, Soph.; βίοτος ὀδυνᾶν λ. a life forgetful of pain, Soph.

div1.head: λαθίφθογγος
div1.sense: robbing of voice, Hes.

div1.head: λαθραῖος
div1.sense: secret, covert, clandestine, furtive, Aesch., Soph.; λ. ὡδί one born in secret child-birth, Eur.:— adv. -ως, Aesch., etc.

div1.head: λάθρῃ
div1.sense: secretly, covertly, by stealth, treacherously, Hom.; λάθρῃ γυῖα βαρύνεται imperceptibly, Il.; so in Attic, Soph., etc.
c. gen. without the knowledge of, unknown to, λάθρῃ Λαομέδοντος Il.; λάθρῃ τῶν στρατηγῶν Hdt.; so in Attic.

div1.head: λάθριος
div1.sense: neut.pl. as adv., treacherously, Theocr.

div1.head: λαθροβόλος
div1.sense: hitting secretly, δόναξ Anth.

div1.head: λαθροδάκνης
div1.sense: biting secretly, Anth.

div1.head: λαθροπόδης
div1.sense: stealthy-paced, Anth.

div1.head: λάθυρος
div1.sense: a kind of pulse: pl. λάθυρα Babr.

div1.head: λᾶιγξ
div1.sense: a small stone, pebble, Od.

div1.head: λαίθαργος
div1.sense: biting secretly, i. e. without barking, of a dog, Ar.

div1.head: λαικάζω
div1.sense: fut. άσομαι, to wench, Ar.

div1.head: λαικαστής
div1.sense: a wencher, Ar.:—fem. λαικάστρια, a wench, harlot, Ar.

div1.head: λαῖλαψ
div1.sense: a tempest, furious storm, hurricane, Hom.

div1.head: λαῖμα
div1.etym: perh. the same as λαιμός, Ar.

div1.head: λαιμαργία
div1.sense: gluttony, Plat.

div1.head: λαίμαργος
div1.sense: very greedy, gluttonous, Arist.

div1.head: λαιμοδακής
div1.sense: throat-biting, Anth.

div1.head: λαιμοπέδη
div1.sense: a dog-collar, Anth.
a springe for catching birds, Anth.

div1.head: λαιμόρρυτος
div1.sense: gushing from the throat, Eur.

div1.head: λαιμός
div1.sense: the throat, gullet, Hom., Eur.

div1.head: λαιμότμητος
div1.sense: with the throat severed, Eur.

div1.head: λαιμότομος
div1.sense: with the throat cut, severed by the throat, Eur.; Γοργοῦς λαιμότομοι σταλαγμοί the blood dripping from the Gorgonʼs severed head, Eur.

div1.head: λαιμοτόμος
div1.sense: throat-cutting, Eur., Anth.
proparox.

div1.head: λαῖνα
div1.sense: = χλαῖνα, Lat. laena, Strab.

div1.head: λάϊνος
div1.sense: of stone or marble, Hom., etc.; λάϊνον ἕσσο χιτῶνα thou hadst put on a coat of stone, i. e. thou hadst been stoned to death, Il.
metaph. stony-hearted, Theocr.

div1.head: λαιός
div1.sense: Lat. laevus, left, λαιᾶς χειρός on the left hand, Aesch.; πρὸς λαιᾷ χερί Eur.

div1.head: λαιοτομέω
div1.sense: to reap corn, Theocr.

div1.head: λαισήϊον
div1.sense: a kind of shield or target, lighter than the ἀσπίς, covered with raw hides, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: λαῖτμα
div1.sense: the depth or gulf of the sea, μέγα λαῖτμα θαλάσσης, ἁλὸς λ. Hom.; alone, λαῖτμα μέγʼ ἐκπερόωσι Od.

div1.head: λαῖφος
div1.sense: a tattered garment, rags, in sg. and pl., Od.
a piece of cloth or canvas, a sail, Aesch.; in pl., Soph.

div1.head: λαιψηρός
div1.sense: light, nimble, swift, Il., Pind., Eur.:—neut. pl. as adv. swiftly, Eur.

div1.head: λακάζω
div1.sense: to shout, howl, Aesch.

div1.head: Λάκαινα
div1.sense: Lacaena, a Laconian woman, Theogn., etc.
as fem. adj. = Λακωνική, Hdt., Eur., etc.

div1.head: λακαταπύγων
div1.sense: very lascivious, Ar.

div1.head: Λακεδαίμων
div1.sense: Lacedaemon, the capital of Laconia, and Laconia itself, Hom., Hdt., etc.
as adj., Hdt., Eur.; but regul. adj. Λακεδαιμόνιος, α, ον, of persons, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: λακέρυζα
div1.etym: from λᾰκεῖν, aor2 inf. of λάσκω
div1.sense: one that screams or cries, λ. κορώνη a cawing crow, Hes.; λ. κύων a yelping dog, ap. Plat.

div1.head: λακίζω
div1.sense: to tear, Anth.

div1.head: λάκισμα
div1.sense: in pl. tatters, Eur.

div1.head: λακίς
div1.sense: a rent, rending, Aesch.; in pl., Aesch.; λακίδες πέπλων tatters, Ar.

div1.head: λακιστός
div1.sense: torn, μόρος λ. death by rending, Luc.

div1.head: λακκόπλουτος
div1.sense: pit-wealth, Comic nickname of Callias, who found a buried treasure, Plut.

div1.head: λάκκος
div1.sense: a pond for water-fowl, Lat. vivarium, Hdt., Dem.
a pit, reservoir, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: λακπάτητος
div1.sense: trampled on, Soph.

div1.head: λακτίζω
div1.sense: to kick with the heel or foot, kick at, spurn, Od.; φλὸξ αἰθέρα λακτίζοισα flames lashing heaven, Pind.; κραδία φόβωι φρένα λακτίζει my heart "knocks at my ribs" for fear, Aesch.; τὸν πεσόντα λακτίσαι to trample on the fallen, Aesch.; τὴν θύραν λ. to kick at the door, Ar.:—Pass., ὑπὸ ἵππου λακτισθείς Xen.
absol. to kick, struggle, of one dying, Od.: proverb., λ. πρὸς κέντρα to kick against the pricks, Pind., Aesch., etc.

div1.head: λάκτισμα
div1.sense: a trampling on, c. gen., Aesch.; λακτιστής, οῦ, one who kicks, ἵπποι λ. kicking horses, Xen.; λ. ληνοῦ a treader of the wine-press, Anth.

div1.head: Λακωνίζω
div1.sense: to imitate the Lacedaemonians, Plat., Xen., etc.
to be in the Lacedaemonian interest, to Laconize, Xen.

div1.head: Λακωνικός
div1.sense: Laconian, Ar., etc.
as Subst.,
ἡ Λακωνική (sub. γῆ) , Laconia, Ar., etc.
Λακωνικαί (sub. ἐμβάδες) , αἱ, Laconian shoes, used by men, Ar.
τὸ Λακωνικόν the state of Lacedaemon, Hdt.

div1.head: Λακωνισμός
div1.sense: imitation of Lacedaemonian manners, Cic.
a being in the Lacedaemonian interest, Laconism, Xen.

div1.head: Λακωνιστής
div1.sense: one who imitates the Lacedaemonians, Plut.
one who takes part with them, a Laconizer, Xen.

div1.head: Λακωνομανέω
div1.sense: to have a Laconomania, Ar.

div1.head: Λάκων
div1.sense: a Laconian or Lacedaemonian, of men, as Λάκαινα of women, Pind., Ar., etc.
as adj. Laconian, Anth.

div1.head: λαλαγέω
div1.sense: to prattle, to babble, Pind.: of birds and grasshoppers, to chirrup, chirp, Theocr.

div1.head: λαλάγημα
div1.sense: prattle, babbling, Anth.

div1.head: λαλέω
div1.sense: to talk, chat, prattle, babble, Ar., etc.:—generally, to talk, say, Soph.
c. acc. to talk of, Theocr.
in late Gr., just like λέγω, to speak, NTest., Thuc.:—Pass., λαληθήσεταί σοι it shall be told thee, NTest.
the proper sense, to chatter, is sometimes opp. to articulate speech, as of monkeys, λαλοῦσι μὲν φράζουσι δὲ οὔ Plut.; of locusts, to chirp, Theocr.
of musical sounds, αὐλῶι λαλεῖν Theocr.

div1.head: λάληθρος
div1.sense: talkative, Anth.

div1.head: λάλημα
div1.sense: talk, prattle, Mosch.
a prater, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: λαλητέος
div1.sense: to be talked of, Anth.

div1.head: λαλητικός
div1.sense: given to babbling, Ar.

div1.head: λαλητρίς
div1.sense: a talker, prattler, Anth.

div1.head: λαλιά
div1.sense: talking, talk, chat, Ar., Anth.
speech, conversation, NTest.; talkativeness, loquacity, Aeschin.
a form of speech, dialect, NTest.

div1.head: λάλλαι
div1.sense: pebbles, from their prattling in the stream, Theocr.

div1.head: λάλος
div1.sense: talkative, babbling, loquacious, Eur., Plat., etc.:—metaph., λάλοι πτέρυγες Anth.:—irr. comp. λαλίστερος Ar.: Sup. λαλίστατος Eur.

div1.head: λαμά
div1.sense: Hebr. words, what? why? NTest.

div1.head: Λαμαχίππιον
div1.sense: little jockey-Lamachus, Ar.

div1.head: Λάμαχος
div1.sense: eager-for-fight, a well-known Athenian general, Ar., Thuc.

div1.head: λαμβάνω
div1.sense: The orig. sense of the word is two-fold, one (more active) to take, and the other (more passive) to receive
to take:

to take hold of, grasp, seize, Hom., etc.; the part seized in gen., the whole in acc., τὴν πτέρυγος λάβεν caught her by the wing, Il.; γούνων λάβε κούρην Od., etc.:—then, with gen. of part only, ποδῶν, γούνων, κόρυθος λάβεν took hold of the feet, etc., Il.
to take by violence, seize, carry off as prize or booty, Hom.
λ. δίκην, ποινάς, Lat. sumere poenas, to exact punishment, Eur., etc.; v. infr. II. 3.
of passions, feelings, etc., to seize, Hom., etc.; of fever and sudden illnesses, to attack, Hdt., Attic
of a deity, to seize, possess, τινά Hdt.: of darkness, and the like, to occupy, possess, Aesch.

to catch, come upon, overtake, as an enemy, Hom., Hdt.: to catch, find, come upon, λ. τινὰ μοῦνον Hdt., etc.: also, to catch, find out, detect, Lat. deprehendo, Hdt.: so Pass., ἐπʼ αὐτοφώρωι εἰλημμένος caught in the act, Ar.
λ. τινὰ ὁρκίοισι to bind him by oaths, Hdt.
to take as an assistant, Soph.
τὴν Ἴδην λαβὼν ἐς ἀριστερὴν χέρα taking, keeping Ida to your left; so, λ. ἐν δεξιᾶι Thuc.
λ. Ἑλληνίδα ἐσθῆτα to assume it, Hdt.

to apprehend by the senses, Soph., Plat.:— to seize with the mind, apprehend, comprehend, Hdt., etc.:— to take, i. e. understand, a thing so and so, e. g. a passage of an author, Lat. accipere, Hdt., Thuc., etc.
to take in hand, undertake, Hdt.
the part. λαβών is almost pleon., as, λαβὼν κύσε χεῖρα took and kissed, Od.; so in Attic
to receive:
to have given one, to get, gain, win, Hom., etc.:—also in bad sense, λ. ὄνειδος Soph.; θάνατον Eur., etc.
to receive in marriage, Hdt., Xen.
λ. δίκην to receive, i. e. suffer, punishment, as we say, to catch it, Lat. dare poenas, Hdt., Eur.: —an unusual sense, v. supr. I. 2.
λ. ὅρκον to accept an oath as a test, Arist.; λ. λόγον to demand an account, Xen.
to conceive, Aesch.
to receive as produce or profit, Ar., Plat.; to purchase Ar.
to admit of, Pind.

of persons subject to feelings, passions, and the like, λ. θυμόν to take heart, Od.; so, periphr., λ. φόβον φοβεῖσθαι, Soph., etc.; so, λ. ὕψος ὑψοῦσθαι, Thuc.; λ. νόσον (as we say) "to take a cold, " Plat.; so, αἱ οἰκίαι ἐπάλξεις λαμβάνουσαι receiving battlements, having battlements added, Thuc.
Mid. to take hold of, lay hold on, c. gen., σχεδίης Od., Hdt., etc.
of place, λ. τῶν ὀρῶν to take to the mountains, reach, gain them, Thuc.

div1.head: λάμβδα
div1.sense: Λ, λ, λάμβδα λάβδα, τό, indecl., eleventh letter of the Gr. Alphabet: as a numeral λ 30, but λ 30, 000.
Attic λ is sometimes represented by π, as κλίβανος κρίβανος, γλώσσαλγος γλώσσαργος, ναύκραρος ναύκληρος, ἀλκ-ή ἀρκ-εῖν: so, ὁλᾷς Θέωλος κόλαξ were lisping pronunc. for ὁρᾷς Θέωρος κόραξ, Ar.
Doric λ becomes ν, as, ἦνθον φίντατος for ἦλθον φίλτατος; whereas Attic λ sometimes replaces ν, as, λίτρον πλεύμων for νίτρον πνεύμων.
initial λ is dropt, as εἴβω for λείβω, αἰψηρὸς ἀφύσσω ἄχνη for λαιψηρὸς λαφύσσω λάχνη.
Epic Poets double λ, metri grat., esp. after the augment, as, ἔλλαβε ἐλλιτάνευε; and in compds., as in τρίλλιστος:—and Homer omits λ, where two come together, metri grat., as Ἀχιλεύς.
δ sometimes becomes λ, cf. δέλτα, II. 5.
γ and λ are interchanged in μόγις μόλις.
ν before λ becomes λ, as in συλλαμβάνω ἐλλείπω.

div1.head: Λάμια
div1.sense: a monster said to feed on manʼs flesh, a bugbear to frighten children with, Ar.

div1.head: λαμπαδαρχία
div1.sense: the superintendence of the λαμπαδηδρομία, a branch of the Gymnasiarchia, Arist.

div1.head: λαμπαδηδρομία
div1.sense: the torch-race, an Athenian ceremony at the festivals of the fire-gods Prometheus, Hephaestus, and Athena, in which the runners carried lighted torches, from the joint altar of these gods in the outer Cerameicus to the Acropolis; after the Persian war Pan received a like honour, Hdt.

div1.head: λαμπαδηφόρος
div1.sense: a torch-bearer, Aesch.

div1.head: λαμπάδιον
div1.sense: a small torch, Plat.
a bandage for wounds, Ar.

div1.head: λαμπαδοῦχος
div1.sense: torch-carrying, bright-beaming, Eur.

div1.head: λαμπάς
div1.sense: a torch, Aesch., Soph., etc.: a beacon-light, Aesch.:—later, an oil-lamp, NTest., Anth.
metaph. of the sun, Soph., Eur., etc.; ἡ ἐπιοῦσα λ. the coming light, i. e. the next day, Eur.
the torch-race, like λαμπαδηδρομία, Hdt.; λαμπάδα δραμεῖν to run the race, Ar.

div1.head: λαμπάς2
div1.sense: gleaming with torches, Soph.

div1.head: λαμπετάω
div1.sense: to shine, only in Epic part. λαμπετόων, shining, ὄσσε δέ οἱ πυρὶ λαμπετόωντι ἐΐκτην Hom.

div1.head: λαμπηδών
div1.sense: lustre, Plut.

div1.head: λάμπη
div1.sense: a torch, Aesch.: light, Aesch.

div1.head: Λάμπος
div1.sense: one of the horses of Aurora, bright, Od.

div1.head: λάμπουρος
div1.sense: as a dogʼs name, firetail, Theocr.

div1.head: λαμπρός
div1.sense: bright, brilliant, radiant, of the sun and stars, the eyes, etc., Il., Attic
of white objects, bright, Od., Hdt.
of water, bright, limpid, Aesch., etc.; of the air, Eur.
of the voice, clear, sonorous, distinct, Lat. clarus, Dem.; so, λαμπρὰ κηρύσσειν Eur.

metaph. of vigorous action, λ. ἄνεμος a fresh keen wind, Hdt.; λ. καὶ μέγας καθιείς swooping down like a fresh and mighty breeze, Ar.; λαμπρὸς φανήσεται he will come vigorously forth, Eur.:—so adv., λαμπρῶς vigorously, Thuc.
metaph. also, clear, manifest, decisive, Aesch., Thuc.: —so adv., λαμπρῶς κοὐδὲν αἰνικτηρίως Aesch.; λελυμένων λ. τῶν σπονδῶν Thuc.; λαμπρῶς ἐλέγετο it was said without concealment, Thuc.
of persons, well-known, illustrious, Hdt., Dem.: also magnificent, munificent, Lat. splendidus, clarus, Dem., etc.
bright, joyous, Soph.
of outward appearance, splendid, brilliant, Xen.; of youthful bloom, Thuc.: —so of dress, etc., Ar., etc.:—adv., λαμπρότατα most splendidly, Xen.

div1.head: λαμπρότης
div1.sense: brilliancy, splendour, Hdt., Attic: —in pl. distinctions, Thuc.
splendid conduct, munificence, Dem.

div1.head: λαμπροφωνία
div1.sense: clearness and loudness of voice, Hdt.

div1.head: λαμπρόφωνος
div1.sense: clear-voiced, Dem.

div1.head: λαμπρύνω
div1.sense: to make bright or brilliant, Xen.:—Mid., ἐλαμπρύνοντο τὰς ἀσπίδας polished their shields, Xen.:— Pass., ὄμμασιν λαμπρύνεται is made clear -sighted, Aesch.; λελάμπρυνται κόρας Soph. ap. Ar.:—also to be or become clear or notorious, Eur.
Mid. to make oneself splendid, pride oneself on a thing, distinguish oneself in, c. dat., Eur., Thuc.

div1.head: λαμπτηρουχία
div1.sense: a holding of torches, watchfire, Aesch.

div1.head: λαμπτήρ
div1.sense: a stand or grate for pine and other wood used for lighting rooms, Od.; ὧ χαῖρε, λ. νυκτός thou that lightest up the night, of the beacon-fire, Aesch.; ἕσπεροι λαμπτῆρες the evening watch-fires, Soph.
generally, = λαμπάs1 Eur., Xen.

div1.head: λάμπω
div1.sense: to give light, shine, beam, be bright, brilliant, radiant, of the gleam of arms, Il.; of the eyes, Il.; of fire, Soph.:—Mid. or Pass., λαμπομένης κόρυθος Il., etc.
of sound, to be clear, ring loud and clear, Soph.
metaph. to shine forth, to be famous or conspicuous, Aesch., Eur., etc.
of persons, φαιδρὸς λάμποντι μετώπωι with beaming face, Ar.: to shine, gain glory, Ar.
trans. to make to shine, light up, Eur., Anth.

div1.head: λαμυρία
div1.sense: audacity, impudence, Plut.

div1.head: λαμυρός
div1.sense: gluttonous, greedy, Theocr.
metaph. bold, wanton, impudent, Xen., Plut.

div1.head: λανθάνω
div1.sense: in most of the act. tenses, to escape notice, to be unknown, unseen, unnoticed:
c. acc. pers., λ. τινά only, to escape his notice, Lat. latere aliquem, Hom., Attic; impers., σὲ λέληθε it has escaped your notice, Plat.
most often with a part. added, in which case we usually translate the part. by a Verb, and express λανθάνω by an Adverb, unawares, without being observed, unseen, unknown; and this, either,
with an acc. pers., ἄλλον τινὰ λήθω μαρνάμενος I am unseen by others while fighting, i. e. I fight unseen by them, Il.; μὴ λάθηι με προσπεσών lest he come on unseen by me, Soph.

without an acc., μὴ διαφθαρεὶς λάθηι lest he perish without himself knowing it, Soph.; δουλεύων λέληθας you are a slave without knowing it, Ar.—This construct. is reversed, as in our idiom, ἀπὸ τείχεος ἆλτο λαθών (for ἔλαθεν ἁλόμενος) Il.; λήθουσά μʼ ἐξέπινες Soph.

the compd. Verbs ἐκληθάνω, ἐπιλήθω (v. sub vocc.), take a Causal sense, to make one forget a thing, c. gen. rei: so in redupl. aor2 λέλαθον, ὄφρα λελάθηι ὀδυνάων that he may cause him to forget his pains, Il.
Mid. and Pass. to let a thing escape one, to forget:
to forget, absol. or c. gen. rei, Hom.; so in redupl. aor., οὐδέ σέθεν θεοὶ λελάθοντο Il., etc.; and in perf. pass., ἐμεῖο λελασμένος Il.; κείνου λελῆσθαι Soph.
to forget purposely, to pass over, ἢ λάθετʼ ἢ οὐκ ἐνόησεν either he chose to forget it or perceived it not, Il.

div1.head: λαξευτός
div1.sense: hewn out of the rock, NTest.

div1.head: λαξεύω
div1.sense: to hew in stone, Lxx.

div1.head: λάξις
div1.sense: an allotment of land, Hdt.

div1.head: λάξ
div1.sense: with the foot, Hom., Aesch.; λὰξ πατεῖσθαι to be trodden under foot, Aesch.

div1.head: λαοδάμας
div1.sense: man-taming: in Hom. as prop. name.

div1.head: λαοδόκος
div1.sense: receiving the people: in Hom. as prop. name Λαόδοκος.

div1.head: λαομέδων
div1.sense: ruler of the people: in Hom. as prop. n.

div1.head: λαοπαθής
div1.sense: suffered by the people, Aesch.

div1.head: λαοπόρος
div1.sense: serving as a passage for the people, man-conveying, λ. μηχαναί, i. e. a bridge, Aesch.

div1.head: λαοσεβής
div1.sense: worshipped by the people, Pind.

div1.head: λαός
div1.sense: Ionic ληός, Attic λεώς:—, the people, both in sg. and pl., i. e.
in the warlike language of Il., the people or men of the army, soldiers; also a land-army, opp. to a fleet; the common men, opp. to their leaders
in the peaceful Od., men, people; so, ναυτικὸς λεώς seafaring folk, Aesch.; ὁ γεωργικὸς λεώς Ar.; ἀκούετε, λεῴ hear o people! the usual way of beginning proclamations at Athens, like our oyez! Ar.
in NTest. of Jews, and later of Christians, as opp. to heathens.

div1.head: λαοσσόος
div1.sense: (σεύω) rousing or stirring nations, Hom.
λαοσσόοι ἀγῶνες assemblies to which the people flock, Pind.
(σώζω) preserving the people or nations, Anth.

div1.head: λαοτέκτων
div1.sense: a stone-worker, Anth.

div1.head: λαοτίνακτος
div1.sense: stirred by a stone, Anth.

div1.head: λαοτρόφος
div1.sense: nourishing or tending the people, Pind.; τιμὴ λ. an office useful to the people, Pind.

div1.head: λαοτύπος
div1.sense: cutting stones, σμίλη Anth.
as Subst. a stone-cutter, statuary, Anth.

div1.head: λαοφθόρος
div1.sense: ruining the people, destructive, c. gen., Theogn.

div1.head: λαοφόνος
div1.sense: slaying the people, Theocr.

div1.head: λαοφόρος
div1.sense: bearing people, λαοφόρος ὁδός a highway, thoroughfare, Il.; ὑπὲρ τῶν μάλιστα λεωφόρων πυλέων over the gates of greatest thoroughfare, Hdt.

div1.head: λαπάρα
div1.sense: the soft part of the body between the ribs and hip, the flank, Il., Hdt., etc.; in pl. the flanks, Lat. ilia, Hdt.

div1.head: λαπαρός
div1.sense: slack, loose, Arist.

div1.head: λα-
div1.sense: insep. Prefix with intensive force, as in λά-μαχος very warlike, λα-κατάρατος much accursed.

div1.head: λάπη
div1.sense: the scum, filth, Aesch.

div1.head: λάπτω
div1.sense: to lap with the tongue, of wolves, Il.
to drink greedily, suck in, Luc.

div1.head: λαρινός
div1.sense: fatted, fat, Ar.; metaph., Ar.

div1.head: Λαρισαῖος
div1.sense: Larissaean, of or from Larissa, Thuc., etc.; Ionic Ληρισσ- Hdt.
as Subst., a kind of kettle or pot, first made at Larissa, Arist.

div1.head: Λάρισα
div1.sense: Larissa, a name of many old Greek cities, Il., etc.:—orig. it denoted a citadel, such as the Larissa of Argos.

div1.head: λάρκος
div1.sense: a charcoal-basket, Ar.

div1.head: λάρναξ
div1.sense: a coffer, box, chest, Il., Hdt.
a cinerary urn or coffin, Il., Thuc.
an ark, in which children were exposed, Simon.

div1.head: λαρός
div1.sense: pleasant to the taste, dainty, sweet, Hom.: —Epic Sup., λᾱρώτατος οἶνος (metri grat. for λᾱρότατος) Od.: comp. λαρότερον as adv., Anth.
pleasant to the smell, Mosch., Anth.
pleasant to the eye, lovely, Anth.
pleasant to the ear, sweet to hear, Anth.

div1.head: λάρος
div1.sense: a ravenous sea-bird, perh. a cormorant, described as dashing down into the sea and then floating on the waves, Od.: metaph. of demagogues, Ar.
a singing bird, Anth.

div1.head: λαρυγγίζω
div1.sense: to shout lustily, bellow, bawl, Dem.
trans. to outdo in shouting, λαρυγγιῶ τοὺς ῥήτορας Ar.

div1.head: λάρυγξ
div1.sense: the larynx or upper part of the windpipe, Arist.:—in Poets the throat, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: λάσανα
div1.sense: always in pl., a trivet or stand for a pot; also a gridiron, Ar.

div1.head: λάσθη
div1.sense: mockery, insult, Hdt.

div1.head: λασιαύχην
div1.sense: with rough, shaggy neck, Hom., Ar., etc.

div1.head: λάσιος
div1.sense: hairy, rough, shaggy, woolly, Hom., Soph., etc.
shaggy with brushwood, bushy, Xen., Theocr.; τὰ λάσια bushes, Xen.

div1.head: λασιόστερνος
div1.sense: hairy-breasted, Anth.

div1.head: λάσκω
div1.sense: to ring, rattle, crash, λάκε χαλκός Il.; λάκε δʼ ὀστέα the bones cracked, broke with a crash, Il.
of animals, to shriek, scream, of the falcon, ὀξὺ λεληκώς Il.; of the nightingale in the falconʼs talons, τί λέληκας; Hes.; also of dogs, to howl, bay, Od.
of men, to shout, scream, cry aloud, Aesch., Soph., etc.; τί λέλᾱκας; Ar.; μή νυν λακήσηις Ar.:—hence of Oracles, to noise abroad, Aesch., etc.: also, to sing, πρὸς αὐλόν Eur.
c. acc. cogn. to shriek forth, utter aloud, Trag.
to crack or burst asunder, NTest.

div1.head: λατομία
div1.sense: in pl., like Lat. lautumiae, quarries, Anth.

div1.head: λατρεία
div1.sense: the state of a hired workman, service, servitude, Trag.
λ. τοῦ θεοῦ, θεῶν service to the gods, divine worship, Plat.; absol., NTest.

div1.head: λάτρευμα
div1.sense: in pl. service for hire, πόνων λατρεύματα painful service, Soph.
service paid to the gods, worship, Eur.
= λάτρις, a slave, Eur.

div1.head: λατρεύω
div1.sense: to work for hire or pay, to be in servitude, serve, Xen.
λ. τινί to be bound or enslaved to, Soph., Eur., etc.; c. acc. pers. to serve, Eur.:—metaph., λατρ. πέτρᾳ, of Prometheus, Aesch.; μόχθοις λατρ. Soph.; λ. νόμοις to obey, Xen.
to serve the gods, λ. Φοίβῳ Eur.: c. acc. cogn., πόνον λ. to render them due service, Eur.

div1.head: λάτριος
div1.sense: of a servant or service, Pind.; παραδιδόναι τινὰ λάτριον to give him into slavery, Pind.

div1.head: λάτρις
div1.sense: a workman for hire, hired servant, and in fem. a handmaid, Theogn., Soph.

div1.head: λάτρον
div1.sense: pay, hire, Aesch. in pl.

div1.head: λαυκανίη
div1.sense: the throat, Il.

div1.head: λαύρα
div1.sense: an alley, lane, passage, Lat. angiportus, Od., Hdt.: a sewer, drain, privy, Ar.

div1.head: Λαύρειον
div1.sense: a mountain in the S. of Attica, famous for its silver-mines, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: Λαυριωτικός
div1.sense: of Mt. Lauri_um, Ar.

div1.head: λαφυγμός
div1.sense: gluttony, Ar.

div1.head: λάφυρα
div1.sense: spoils taken in war, Lat. spolia, Trag., Xen.

div1.head: λαφυροπωλέω
div1.sense: to sell booty, Xen.

div1.head: λαφυροπώλης
div1.sense: a seller of booty, one who has bought up booty to retail, Lat. sector, Xen.

div1.head: λαφύσσω
div1.sense: to swallow greedily, gulp down, devour, Il.; metaph. of fire, to consume, Anth.

div1.head: λαφύστιος
div1.sense: gluttonous, Hdt., Anth.

div1.head: λαχαίνω
div1.sense: to dig, Mosch.

div1.head: λαχανηλόγος
div1.sense: gathering vegetables, Anth.

div1.head: λαχανισμός
div1.sense: a gathering of vegetables, Thuc.

div1.head: λάχανον
div1.sense: mostly in pl. garden-herbs, potherbs, vegetables, greens, Lat. olera, Plat., etc.
in pl. also, the vegetable-market, green-market, Ar.

div1.head: λαχανόπτερος
div1.sense: vegetable-winged, Luc.

div1.head: λαχανοπώλης
div1.sense: one who sells vegetables, a green-grocer; fem. λαχανόπωλις, ιδος, Ar.

div1.head: λάχεια
div1.sense: fem. adj. well-tilled, fertile, Od.:—others read ἐλάχεια, from ἐλαχύς, small.

div1.head: Λάχεσις
div1.sense: Lachesis, disposer of lots, one of the three Fates, Hes., Pind.; v. Κλωθώ.
λάχεσις, ιος, as appellative, lot, destiny, ap. Hdt.

div1.head: λαχή
div1.sense: allotment, τάφων πατρῴων λαχαί a share in their fathersʼ tombs, Aesch.

div1.head: λαχνήεις
div1.sense: hairy, shaggy, Il., Pind.

div1.head: λάχνη
div1.sense: soft hair, down, Lat. lanugo, of a young manʼs beard, Od., Pind.; of the thin hair on Thersitesʼ head, Il.; of the nap or pile on cloth, Il.; of sheepʼs wool, Soph.

div1.head: λαχνόγυιος
div1.sense: with shaggy limbs, Eur.

div1.head: λαχνόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to grow downy, of a youthʼs chin, Solon., Anth.

div1.head: λάχνος
div1.sense: wool, Od.

div1.head: λαχνώδης
div1.sense: downy, Eur.

div1.head: λάχος
div1.sense: an allotted portion, Lat. sors:
oneʼs special lot, portion, destiny, Theogn., Soph.: oneʼs appointed office, Aesch.
a portion obtained by lot, a lot, share, portion, Aesch., Xen.

div1.head: λάω
div1.sense: = βλέπω, to behold, look upon, c. acc., Od.; ὀξὺ λάων quick of sight, Hhymn.

div1.head: λάω
div1.etym: an old Doric Verb, found only in pres.
λῶ, λῆις, λῆι, λῶμες, λῆτε, λῶντι:— subj., 2 and 3rd sg. λῆις, λῆι: opt. 3rd sg. λώιη: inf. λῆν: part. τῶι λῶντι.
div1.sense: =θέλω, to wish, desire

div1.head: λαώδης
div1.sense: popular, Lat. popularis, Plut.

div1.head: λέαινα
div1.sense: a lioness, Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: λεαίνω
div1.sense: to smooth or polish, Hom.; ἵπποισι κέλευθον λειανέω I will smooth the way, Il.
to rub smooth, pound in a mortar, Lat. levigare, Hdt.; to grind with the teeth, Xen.:— generally, to crush, extirpate, Hdt.
to smooth away wrinkles, Plat.:—metaph. to smooth or soften down harsh words, Hdt.

div1.head: λεάντειρα
div1.sense: fem. adj. smoothing, polishing, Anth.

div1.head: λέβης
div1.sense: a kettle or caldron of copper, Hom., etc.
a basin in which the purifying water (χέρνιψ) was handed to the guests before meals, Od.; also a pan for washing the feet, Od.: a bath, Aesch.
a cymbal, Hdt.
a cinerary urn, Aesch., Soph.:—generally, a casket, Soph.

div1.head: λεγεών
div1.sense: the Lat. legio, NTest., Plut.

div1.head: λέγω
div1.sense: to gather, pick up, Lat. lego, colligo, Hom., Pind.; αἱμασιὰς λέγων picking out stones for building walls, Od.:—Mid. to gather for oneself, Il.
Mid. to choose for oneself, pick out, Hom.:—Pass. to be chosen, Il.
to count, tell, reckon up, Od.; μετὰ τοῖσιν ἐλέγμην I reckoned myself among them, Od.; λέκτο δʼ ἀριθμόν he told him over the number, Od.:—Pass., μετὰ τοῖσιν ἐλέχθην I was counted among these, Il.
so in Attic, λ. ἐν ἐχθροῖς to count among oneʼs enemies, count as a foe, Aesch.; λ. τινὰ οὐδαμοῦ to count him as naught, nullo in numero habere, Soph.
to recount, tell over, Od., Aesch., etc.:—Mid., τί σὲ χρὴ ταῦτα λέγεσθαι; why needʼst thou tell the tale thereof? Il.; μηκέτι ταῦτα λεγώμεθα Il.
to say, speak, Hdt., Trag., etc.; λέγε say on, Hdt.; so, λέγοις ἄν Plat.: of oracles, to say, declare, Hdt.
λέγειν τινά τι to say something of another, esp., κακὰ λ. τινά to speak ill of him, abuse, revile him, Hdt.; ἀγαθὰ λ. τινά Ar.;—also, εὖ or κακῶς λ. τινά Aesch., etc.
to call by name, Soph.:— to call so and so, οὔτοι γυναῖκας ἀλλὰ Γοργόνας λέγω Aesch.
λ. τινὰ or τινὶ ποιεῖν τι to tell one to do, Soph., Xen., etc.

λ. τι to say something, i. e. to speak to the point or purpose, Soph.; λέγω τι; am I right? Soph.; opp. to οὐδὲν λέγει, has no meaning, no authority, Ar.; but οὐδὲν λέγειν, also, to say what is not, to lie, Ar., Plat., etc.

like Lat. dicere, to mean, τί τοῦτο λέγει; what does this mean? Ar., Plat.; πῶς λέγεις; how mean you? Plat.:—to explain more fully, εἴσω κομίζου σύ, Κασάνδραν λέγω get thee in—thou, I mean Cassandra, Aesch.; ποταμός Ἀχελῶιον λέγω Soph.

Pass., λέγεται, like Lat. dicitur, it is said, on dit, Hdt., Attic; also λέγονται εἶναι they are said to be, Xen.:— τὸ λεγόμενον, absol., as the saying goes, Thuc., etc.:— ὁ λεγόμενος the so-called, οἱ λ. αὐτόνομοι εἶναι Xen.
of orators, to speak (emphatically), λέγειν δεινός Soph.; λ. τε καὶ πράσσειν δυνατώτατος Thuc.
to boast of, tell of, Xen.: to recite what is written, λαβὲ τὸ βιβλίον καὶ λέγε Plat., etc.:—but the sense of Lat. lego, to read, only occurs in compds., ἀναλέγομαι, ἐπιλέγομαι.

div1.head: λέχομαι
div1.etym: Pass. is only found in 3rd sg. Epic aor2
div1.sense: part. to lay asleep, lull to sleep, λέξον με Il.; ἔλεξα Διὸς νόον Il.: —Pass. and Mid. to lie asleep, to lie, Hom.

div1.head: λεηλασία
div1.sense: a making of booty, robbery, Xen.

div1.head: λεηλατέω
div1.sense: to drive away cattle as booty, to make booty, Soph., Xen.
c. acc. loci, to plunder, despoil, Hdt.

div1.head: λεία
div1.sense: booty, plunder, Hdt., Soph., Eur., etc.:—generally, pillageable property, Thuc., Xen.; λείαν ποιεῖσθαι χώραν λεηλατεῖν χώραν, Thuc.:— Μυσῶν λεία, of anything that may be plundered with impunity, from the effeminate character of the Mysians, Dem.
plunder (as an act), ζῆν ἀπὸ ληίης Hdt.

div1.head: λείβω
div1.sense: to pour, pour forth, οἶνον λείβειν to make a libation of wine, Hom.; also λείβειν (without οἶνον) Il.; λείβειν θεοῖς Od.

like εἴβω, to let flow, shed, δάκρυα λ. Hom., Trag.: —Pass., of the tears, to be shed, pour forth, Eur., Xen.; of persons, λείβεσθαι δακρύοις κόρας to have oneʼs eyes running with tears, Eur.: metaph. of sound, Pind.
in Pass., also, to melt or pine away, Ar.

div1.head: λεῖμαξ
div1.sense: a meadow, Eur., Anth.

div1.head: λεῖμμα
div1.sense: τοῦ παιδὸς τὰ λείμματα what was left of him, his remains, Hdt.

div1.head: λειμώνιος
div1.sense: of a meadow, Lat. pratensis, Aesch., Theocr.

div1.head: λειμωνόθεν
div1.sense: from a meadow, Il.; also λειμωνόθε, Theocr.

div1.head: λειμών
div1.sense: any moist, grassy place, a meadow, mead, holm, Lat. pratum, Hom., Aesch., etc.

div1.head: λειογένειος
div1.sense: smooth-chinned, Hdt.

div1.head: λειοκύμων
div1.sense: having low waves, Luc.

div1.head: λειόμιτος
div1.sense: smoothing the warp, Anth.

div1.head: λειοντῆ
div1.sense: a lionʼs skin, Anth.

div1.head: λειοντομάχης
div1.sense: a lion-fighter, Theocr.

div1.head: λειοντοπάλης
div1.sense: a wrestler with a lion, Anth.

div1.head: λεῖος
div1.sense: Lat. levis, smooth, Il., Plat., etc.:—of cloths, smooth, plain, not embroidered, Thuc.
smooth, level, flat, of land, Hom.; λεῖα δʼ ἐποίησεν θεμείλια levelled them with the ground, Il.:—c. gen., χῶρος λεῖος πετράων smooth (i. e. free) from rocks, Od.
smooth-skinned, beardless, Theocr.
metaph. smooth, soft, of wind, Ar.; of words, Aesch.

div1.head: λειότης
div1.sense: smoothness, Aesch., Xen., etc.

div1.head: λειπτέος
div1.sense: one must leave or abandon, Eur., Plat., etc.

div1.head: λείπω
div1.sense: trans.,
to leave, quit, Hom., etc.
to leave behind, leave at home, Hom., etc.; esp. of dying men, to leave (as a legacy), Il., etc.:— so in Mid. to leave behind one, as a memorial, Hdt., etc.
to leave, forsake, abandon, desert, leave in the lurch, Il., etc.; λ. ἐράνους to fail in paying . . , Dem.; so, λ. δασμόν, φοράν Xen.:—conversely, λίπον ἰοὶ ἄνακτα the arrows failed him, Od.
intr. to be gone, to be wanting, cease, be missing, Lat. deficio, Soph., Eur., etc.
Pass. to be left, left behind, Hom., etc.
to remain, remain over and above, Il., Hdt., etc.
to remain alive, Od.
c. gen. to be left without, to be forsaken of, σοῦ λελειμμένη Soph.;— but, λελειμμένος δορός left by the spear, i. e. not slain, Aesch.

to be left behind in a race, Il.; λελειμμένος οἰῶν lingering behind the sheep, Od.; ἐς δίσκουρα λέλειπτο he had been left behind as much as a quoitʼs throw, Il.; τοῦ κήρυκος μὴ λείπεσθαι not to be behind the herald, Thuc.
to come short of, be inferior, worse, weaker or less than, τινος Hdt., Attic; λέλειψαι τῶν ἐμῶν βουλευμάτων you come short of, understand not my plans, Eur.
λείπεσθαι ἀπό τινος to keep aloof from one, Il.; λ. βασιλέος or ἀπὸ βασιλέος to desert the king, Hdt.:—absol. to keep aloof, be absent, Il.
to be wanting or lacking in a thing, ὀδυρμάτων ἐλείπετʼ οὐδέν Soph., etc.

div1.head: λειριόεις
div1.sense: properly, like a lily: metaph., χρὼς λειριόεις lily skin, Il.; of the cicadae, ὂψ λειριόεσσα their delicate voice, Il.

div1.head: λείριον
div1.sense: a lily, esp. the white lily, Hhymn.

sense.trans: of or for the people, public.

div1.head: λειτουργέω
div1.sense: at Athens, to serve public offices at oneʼs own cost, Oratt.; τὰ λελειτουργημένα the services performed, Dem.
generally, to perform public duties, to serve the people or state, τῇ πόλει Xen.; so, λ. τοῖς σώμασι to serve in oneʼs own person, Dem.
more generally, to serve a master, c. dat., Arist.
to perform religious service, minister, NTest.

div1.head: λειτούργημα
div1.sense: the performance of a λειτουργία, Plut.

div1.head: λειτουργία
div1.sense: at Athens, a liturgy, i. e. a public duty, which the richer citizens discharged at their own expense.—The ordinary liturgies (ἐγκύκλιοι) were the γυμνασιαρχία, χορηγία, and ἑστίασις: the extraordinary, such as the τριηραρχία, were reserved for special occasions.
generally, any service or ministration, help, NTest.
the public service of the gods, Arist.:— the service or ministry of priests, NTest.: hence our word liturgy.

div1.head: λειτουργικός
div1.sense: ministering, NTest.

div1.head: λειτουργός
div1.sense: at Athens, one who performed a λειτουργία (q. v.).
a public servant, the Roman lictor, Plut.: metaph., λ. τῆς χρείας ἐμῆς ministering to my need, NTest.
in religious sense, a minister, NTest.

div1.head: λειχήν
div1.sense: a tree-moss, lichen, then, a lichenlike eruption, canker, scurvy, blight, Aesch.

div1.head: Λειχήνωρ
div1.sense: lick-man, name of a mouse, Batr.: so also Λειχο-μύλη, ἡ, Lick-meal, Batr.:

div1.head: Λειχοπίναξ
div1.sense: lick-platter, Batr.

div1.head: λείχω
div1.sense: to lick up, Hdt., Aesch., Ar.
irreg. part. perf., γλώσσηισι λελειχμότες playing with their tongues, Hes.

div1.head: λειψανηλόγος
div1.sense: gathering remnants, Anth.

div1.head: λείψανον
div1.sense: a piece left, wreck, remnant, relic, Eur.
in pl., remains, remnants, Lat. reliquiae, of the dead, Soph., Plat.;—but, ἀγαθῶν ἀνδρῶν λ. are their deeds, good name, Eur.; λείψανα, remnants of youth, Ar.

div1.head: Λειψύδριον
div1.sense: a waterless district near mount Parnes in Attica, Hdt.

div1.head: λειώδης
div1.sense: smooth; as pr. n. in Hom.

div1.head: λεκάνη
div1.sense: a hod, Ar.

div1.head: λεκάνιον
div1.sense: Dim. of λεκάνη, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: λεκιθοπώλης
div1.sense: a peasepudding-seller, Ar.

div1.head: λέκιθος
div1.sense: pulse-porridge, peasepudding, Ar.

div1.head: λέκος
div1.sense: a dish, plate, pot, pan, Hippon.

div1.head: λεκτέος
div1.sense: to be said or spoken, Plat.
λεκτέον, one must speak, Plat.

div1.head: λεκτικός
div1.sense: able to speak, Xen.
suited for speaking, Dem.

div1.head: λεκτός
div1.sense: (λέγω2) gathered, chosen, picked out, Aesch., Soph., etc.
(λέγω3) capable of being spoken, to be spoken, Soph., Eur., etc.

div1.head: λέκτρον
div1.sense: a couch, bed, Lat. lectus, in sg. and pl., Hom.; λέκτρονδε to bed, Od.
pl. the marriage-bed, Pind., Trag.; ἀλλότρια, νόθα, λέκτρα, of illicit connexions, Eur.

div1.head: λεληθότως
div1.etym: adverb from part. perf. of λανθάνω,
div1.sense: imperceptibly, Plat.

div1.head: λελίημαι
div1.sense: to strive eagerly, in part. λελιημένος, Il.; as a mere adj. eager, in haste, Il.: later 3rd sg. plup., Theocr.

div1.head: λελογισμένως
div1.sense: according to calculation, Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: λέμβος
div1.sense: a boat, Lat. lembus, a shipʼs cock-boat, Dem.
a fishing-boat, Theocr.

div1.head: λέμμα
div1.sense: that which is peeled off, peel, husk, skin, scale, Ar.

div1.head: λέντιον
div1.sense: Lat. linteum, a cloth, napkin, NTest.

div1.head: λέξις
div1.sense: a speaking, saying, speech, Plat.
a way of speaking, diction, style, Plat., etc.
κατὰ λέξιν as the phrase goes, Anth.

div1.head: λεοντέη
div1.sense: (sub. δορά ) a lionʼs skin, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: λεόντεος
div1.sense: of a lion, Theocr.

div1.head: λεοντόβοτος
div1.sense: fed on by lions, Strab.

div1.head: λεοντόδιφρος
div1.sense: in chariot drawn by lions, Anth.

div1.head: λεοντοκέφαλος
div1.sense: lion-headed, Luc.

div1.head: λεοντοφόνος
div1.sense: lion-killing, Anth.

div1.head: λεοντοφόρος
div1.sense: bearing the figure of a lion, Luc.

div1.head: λεοντοφυής
div1.sense: of lion nature, Eur.

div1.head: λεοντόχλαινος
div1.sense: clad in a lionʼs skin, Anth.

div1.head: λεοντώδης
div1.sense: lion-like, Plat., etc.

div1.head: λέπαδνον
div1.sense: a broad leather strap fastening the yoke (ζυγόν) to the neck, and passing between the fore-legs to the girth (μασχαλιστήρ) , mostly in pl., Il., Aesch.: so metaph., ἀνάγκης δῦναι λέπαδνον to put on the halter of necessity, Aesch.

div1.head: λεπαῖος
div1.sense: rocky, rugged, Eur.

div1.head: λέπαργος
div1.sense: with white coat, Theocr.

div1.head: λεπάς
div1.sense: a limpet, from its clinging to the rock (λέπας) , Ar.

div1.head: λέπας
div1.sense: a bare rock, scaur, crag, Aesch., Eur., etc.

div1.head: λεπαστή
div1.sense: a limpet-shaped drinking-cup, Ar.

div1.head: λεπιδόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be covered with scales.

div1.head: λεπιδωτός
div1.sense: scaly, covered with scales, of the crocodile, Hdt.; of scale-armour, Hdt.
as Subst., a fish of the Nile with large scales, Hdt.

div1.head: λεπίς
div1.sense: a scale, husk, λ. ᾠοῦ an egg- shell, Ar.; the cup of a filbert, Anth.
collectively, the scales of fish, Hdt.

div1.head: λέπρα
div1.sense: leprosy, Hdt.

div1.head: λεπρός
div1.sense: scaly, scabby, rough, leprous, Ar.

div1.head: λεπταλέος
div1.sense: fine, delicate, Il., Anth.

div1.head: λεπτεπίλεπτος
div1.sense: thin-upon-thin, i. e. thin as thin can be, Anth.

div1.head: λεπτόγειος
div1.sense: of thin, poor soil, Thuc.

div1.head: λεπτόγραμμος
div1.sense: written small or neat, Luc.

div1.head: λεπτόγραφος
div1.sense: written small or neat, Luc.

div1.head: λεπτόδομος
div1.sense: slightly framed, slight, Aesch.

div1.head: λεπτολογέω
div1.sense: to talk subtly, to chop logic, quibble, Ar.; λ. τι to discuss in quibbling fashion, Luc.:—so as Dep. λεπτολογέομαι, Luc.

div1.head: λεπτολόγος
div1.sense: speaking subtly, subtle, quibbling, Ar.

div1.head: λεπτόμιτος
div1.sense: of fine threads, Eur., Anth.

div1.head: λεπτόν
div1.sense: sc. νόμισμα a very small coin, a mite, NTest.

div1.head: λεπτός
div1.sense: peeled, husked, threshed out, Il.
fine, small, of dust, ashes, etc., Il., Soph., Ar.
thin, fine, delicate, of cloth, thread, etc., Hom., Eur.
of the human figure, thin, lean, meagre, Ar., Xen.: also slender, taper, Plat.
of space, like στενός, strait, narrow, Od.; ἐπὶ λεπτόν in a thin line, Xen.
generally, small, weak, impotent, μῆτις Il.; ἐλπίς Ar.; λ. ἴχνη faint traces, Xen.; τὰ λεπτὰ τῶν προβάτων small cattle, i. e. sheep and goats, Hdt.; λ. πλοῖα small craft, Hdt., etc.
light, slight, of sounds, Aesch.; λ. πνοαί light breezes, Eur.
of wine, light, Luc.
metaph. fine, subtle, refined, νοῦς, μῦθος Eur., etc.:— so adv., λεπτῶς μεριμνᾶν Plat.

div1.head: λεπτότης
div1.sense: thinness: fineness, delicacy, leanness, Plat.
metaph. subtlety, Ar.

div1.head: λεπτοτομέω
div1.sense: to cut small, mince, Strab.

div1.head: λεπτουργέω
div1.sense: to do fine work, of joiners and turners, Plut.
metaph. = λεπτολογέω, Eur.

div1.head: λεπτουργής
div1.sense: finely worked, Hhymn.

div1.head: λεπτύνω
div1.sense: to make small or fine: to thresh out, winnow, Anth.:—Pass. to be reduced, grow lean, Arist.; τοὺς ὤμους λεπτύνεσθαι Xen.

div1.head: λεπυριώδης
div1.sense: consisting of coats or layers, like the onion, Arist.

div1.head: λέπω
div1.sense: to strip off the rind or husks, to peel, bark, περὶ γάρ ῥά ἑ χαλκὸς ἔλεψεν φύλλα τε καὶ φλοιόν Il.
metaph. in Com. poets, to hide, i. e. thrash.

div1.head: Λέρνα
div1.sense: Lerna, in Argolis, the abode of the Hydra, Eur.:—adj. Λερναῖος, η, ον or ος, ον, Hes., Eur.

div1.head: Λεσβιάζω
div1.sense: to imitate Sappho (the Lesbian poetry), Ar.

div1.head: Λέσβιος
div1.sense: Lesbian, of Lesbos, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: Λεσβίς
div1.sense: a Lesbian woman, Il.; so Λεσβιάς, άδος, Anth.

div1.head: Λεσβόθεν
div1.sense: from Lesbos, Il.

div1.head: Λέσβος
div1.sense: Lesbos, an island on the W. coast of Asia Minor, Hom., etc.

div1.head: λεσχάζω
div1.sense: to prate, chatter, Theogn.

div1.head: λεσχηνεία
div1.sense: gossip, Plat.

div1.head: λεσχηνεύω
div1.sense: to chat or converse with, τινί App.; in Mid. to chat, converse, cf. προ-λεσχηνεύομαι.

div1.head: λέσχη
div1.sense: a place where people assembled to talk and hear news, a lounge, club-room, Od., etc.: —also a council-hall, council, Aesch., Soph.
talk or gossip, such as went on in the λέσχαι, Eur.:— in good sense, conversation, discussion, Hdt., Soph.

div1.head: λευγαλέος
div1.sense: in sad or sorry plight, wretched, pitiful, dismal, Od.:—adv., so, λευγαλέως χωρεῖν to go in ill plight, Il.

div1.head: Λευίτης
div1.sense: a Levite, NTest.

div1.head: λευκαίνω
div1.sense: to make white, whiten, Od., Eur., etc.
to make bright or light, ἠὼς λευκαίνει φῶς morn brightens up her light, Eur.

div1.head: λευκανθής
div1.sense: white-blossoming; generally, blanched, white, Pind.; v. χνοάζω.

div1.head: λευκανθίζω
div1.sense: to have white blossoms: generally, to be white or made white, Hdt., Babr.

div1.head: λευκάργιλλος
div1.sense: of or with white clay, Strab.

div1.head: λεύκασπις
div1.sense: white-shielded, Il., Xen.:—in Trag. the Argives are λευκάσπιδες.

div1.head: λευκάς
div1.sense: poet. fem. of λευκός, Eur.

div1.head: λεύκη
div1.sense: white leprosy, Hdt., etc.
the white poplar, Lat. populus alba, Ar., Dem.

div1.head: λευκήρετμος
div1.sense: with white oars, Eur.

div1.head: λευκήρης
div1.sense: white, blanched, Aesch.

div1.head: Λευκιππίδες
div1.sense: daughters of Leucippus, nymphs worshipped at Sparta, Eur.

div1.head: λεύκιππος
div1.sense: riding or driving white horses, Pind., Soph.; λ. ἀγυιαί streets thronged with white horses, Pind.

div1.head: λευκογραφέω
div1.sense: to paint in white on a coloured ground, Arist.

div1.head: Λευκοθέα
div1.sense: the white goddess, under which name Ino was worshipped as a sea-goddess, Od.

div1.head: λευκόθριξ
div1.sense: λευκότριχος, ον, white-haired, white, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: λευκοθώραξ
div1.sense: with white cuirass, Xen.

div1.head: λευκόϊνος
div1.sense: made of λευκόϊον, Anth.

div1.head: λευκόϊον
div1.sense: for λευκὸν ἴον, literally white-violet, but used for
the wall-flower, Theocr., etc.
a bulbous plant, the snow-flake, Anth.

div1.head: λευκοκύμων
div1.sense: white with surf, Eur.

div1.head: λευκόλινον
div1.sense: white flax for ropes and rigging, Hdt.

div1.head: λευκόλοφος
div1.sense: white-crested, Ar.:—as Subst. λευκόλοφον, τό, a white hill, Anth.

div1.head: λευκόν
div1.sense: white, as a colour, τὸ λ. οἶδεν knows black from white, Ar.
a white dress, λευκὸν ἀμπέχει are dressed in white, Ar.

div1.head: λευκοόπωρος
div1.sense: with white fruit, Anth.

div1.head: λευκοπάρειος
div1.sense: fair-cheeked, Anth.

div1.head: λευκόπετρον
div1.sense: a white rock, Polyb.

div1.head: λευκόπηχυς
div1.sense: gen. εως, white-armed, Eur.

div1.head: λευκόπους
div1.sense: white-footed, bare-footed, Eur.

div1.head: λευκόπτερος
div1.sense: white-winged, of a ship, Eur.:—generally, white, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: λευκόπωλος
div1.sense: with white horses, Trag.

div1.head: λευκός
div1.sense: light, bright, brilliant, of sun light, Hom., Soph.; and of metallic surfaces, λέβης Il.; also, λ. γαλήνη a glassy calm, Od.; of water, generally, bright, limpid, Hom., Eur.
metaph. clear, plain, distinct, of authors, Anth.
of colour, white, Hom., etc.; λ. ἅρμα λεύκιππον, Eur.

of the skin, white, fair, Hom., Trag.; with a notion of bare, πούς Eur., cf. λευκόπους:—later, as a mark of effeminacy, blanched, white, pale, Ar., Xen.:— λευκαὶ φρένες in Pind. may be pale with envy, envious.
λ. χρυσός, pale gold, i. e. gold alloyed with silver (prob. the same as ἤλεκτρον) , opp. to χρυσὸς ἄπεφθος, Hdt.
λευκὸν ἦμαρ νυκτὸς ἐκ μελαγχίμου a bright day after a night of mourning, Aesch.

div1.head: λευκόστικτος
div1.sense: grizzled, Eur.

div1.head: λευκόσφυρος
div1.sense: white-ankled, Theocr.

div1.head: λευκότροφος
div1.sense: white-growing, Ar.

div1.head: λευκοφαής
div1.sense: white-gleaming, Eur.

div1.head: λευκοφόρος
div1.sense: white-robed, Anth.

div1.head: λεύκοφρυς
div1.sense: white-browed, Orac. ap. Hdt.

div1.head: λευκοχίτων
div1.sense: white-coated, Batr.See also LSJ Supp.

div1.head: λευκόχροος
div1.sense: of white complexion: heterocl. acc. λευκόχροα κόμαν Eur.

div1.head: λευκόχρως
div1.sense: white-skinned, Theocr.

div1.head: λευκόω
div1.sense: to make white: λ. πόδα to bare the foot, Anth.:—Mid., λευκοῦσθαι τὰ ὅπλα to whiten their shields, Xen.:—Pass. to be or become white, Pind.

div1.head: λευκώλενος
div1.sense: white-armed, Hom., Hes.

div1.head: λεύκωμα
div1.sense: a tablet covered with gypsum to write on, a notice-board, register, Lat. album, Oratt.

div1.head: λευρός
div1.sense: smooth, level, even, Od., Aesch., Eur.
smooth, polished, Pind.

div1.head: λεύσιμος
div1.sense: stoning, Eur.; λ. καταφθοραί or θάνατος death by stoning, Eur.; λ. ἀραί curses that will end in stoning, Aesch.

div1.head: λευσμός
div1.sense: a stoning, Aesch.

div1.head: λεύσσω
div1.sense: to look or gaze upon, see, behold, Il., Trag.
absol. to look, gaze, Hom., Soph., etc.:— ὁ μὴ λεύσσων he that sees no more, i. e. is dead, Soph.; so, εἰ λεύσσει φάος if he still sees the light, Eur.
c. acc. cogn., λεύσσειν δέργμα δράκοντος to look the look of a dragon, Aesch.; λ. φόνον to look murder, Theocr.

div1.head: λευστήρ
div1.sense: one who stones, a stoner, Eur.: —in Orac. ap. Hdt., λευστήρ is prob. one deserving to be stoned.
as adj., λευστὴρ μόρος death by stoning, Aesch.

div1.head: λεύω
div1.sense: to stone, Thuc., Eur.:—Pass., λευσθῆναι πέτροις Soph.

div1.head: λεχαῖος
div1.sense: in bed, τέκνα λεχαῖα nestlings, Aesch.

div1.head: λεχεποίη
div1.sense: grown with grass fit to make a bed, i. e. grassy, meadowy, Il., Hhymn.

div1.head: λεχεποίης
div1.sense: of the river Asopus, from its grassy banks, Il., Orac. ap. Hdt.

div1.head: λεχήρης
div1.sense: bed-ridden, Eur.

div1.head: λέχοσδε
div1.sense: to bed, Hom.

div1.head: λέχος
div1.sense: a couch, bed, Hom., etc.
a kind of state-bed or bier, Il., etc.
a marriage-bed, and generally marriage, Od., Trag.; so in pl. τὰ νυμφικὰ λ. Soph.; γῆμαι μείζω λέχη to make a great marriage, Eur., etc.:—also for the concrete, σὰ λέχεα thy spouse, Eur.
a birdʼs nest, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: λέχριος
div1.sense: slanting, slantwise, crosswise, Lat. obliquus, Soph., Eur.:—metaph., πάντα γὰρ λ. τἀν χεροῖν all the business in hand is cross, Soph.

div1.head: λέχρις
div1.sense: crosswise, Lat. oblique.

div1.head: λεχώϊος
div1.sense: of or belonging to child-bed, δῶρα λεχ. presents made at the birth, Anth.

div1.head: λεχώ
div1.sense: a woman in childbed, or one who has just given birth, Lat. puerpera, Eur.

div1.head: Λεωκόρειον
div1.sense: the temple of the daughters of Leos, Thuc.

div1.head: λέων
div1.sense: Lat. leo, a lion, Hom.; of Artemis, Ζεύς σε λέοντα γυναιξὶ θῆκε Zeus made thee a lion toward women, because she was supposed to cause their sudden death, Il.; οἴκοι λέοντες, ἐν μάχῃ δʼ ἀλώπεκες Ar.
= λεοντῆ, a lionʼs skin, Luc.

div1.head: λεωργός
div1.sense: one who will do anything, i. e. audacious, villainous, a knave, Aesch.; λεωργότατος Xen.

div1.head: λέως
div1.sense: entirely, wholly, λ. οὐδέν nothing at all, Archil.; cf. λεωργός.

div1.head: λεωσφέτερος
div1.sense: one of their own people, a fellow-citizen, Hdt.

div1.head: λήγω
div1.sense: to stay, abate, like παύω, Il.:—c. gen., χεῖρας λήγειν φόνοιο to stay hands from murder, Od.
intr. to leave off, cease, come to an end, Il., Hdt., Attic: c. gen. to stop or cease from a thing, χόλοιο, φόνοιο, etc., Il., Attic: c. part to cease doing, λήγειν ἀείδων Il., etc.

div1.head: λῆδον
div1.sense: a shrub, the mastich, on which the gum λάδανον is found, cistus creticus.

div1.head: λῆδος
div1.sense: a light summer dress, Alcman.

div1.head: λήθαιος
div1.sense: of or from Lethe, Lethean, Anth.

div1.head: ληθαργικός
div1.sense: drowsy, Anth.

div1.head: λήθαργος
div1.sense: forgetful: c. gen. forgetful of, Anth.,
as Subst. lethargy, Arist.

div1.head: ληθεδανός
div1.sense: causing forgetfulness, Luc.

div1.head: λήθη
div1.sense: a forgetting, forgetfulness, Lat. oblivio, Il., Attic; λ. παρέχειν, ἐμποιεῖν Plat.; εἰς λήθην ἐμβάλλειν τινά Aeschin., etc.
after Hom., a place of oblivion in the lower world, Simon., etc.

div1.head: ληϊάς
div1.sense: taken prisoner, captive, Il.

div1.head: ληϊβοτήρ
div1.sense: crop-consuming, crop destroying: fem., σῦς ληιβότειρα, Od.

div1.head: ληΐδιος
div1.sense: taken as booty, captive, Anth.

div1.head: ληΐζομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:
to seize as booty, to carry off as prey, Hom., Hdt.:—generally, to get by force, to gain, get, Hes.
to plunder, despoil, esp. by raids or forays, ἀλλήλους Thuc., Xen.
absol. to plunder, Hdt.
perf. λέλῃσμαι in pass. sense, to be carried off, taken as booty, Eur.

div1.head: ληϊνόμος
div1.sense: dwelling in the country, Anth.

div1.head: λήϊον
div1.sense: a crop, Lat. seges, ὡς δʼ ὅτε κινήσῃ Ζέφυρος βαθὺ λήιον Il.; so Hes., Hdt.
a corn-field, field, Theocr., Babr.

div1.head: ληΐς
div1.sense: booty, spoil, Hom., etc.; mostly of cattle, Il.; and without notion of plunder, cattle, stock, Hes., Theocr.

div1.head: ληϊστήρ
div1.sense: a robber, esp. a pirate, rover, Od.

div1.head: ληϊστός
div1.sense: to be carried off as booty, to be won by force, Il.; also (with the vowel shortd.) λεϊστός Il.

div1.head: ληϊστύς
div1.sense: plundering, Ionic form in Hdt.

div1.head: ληΐστωρ
div1.sense: = ληΐστήρ, Od.
as adj. plundering, Anth.

div1.head: ληῖτις
div1.sense: she who makes or dispenses booty, Il.

div1.head: λήϊτον
div1.sense: Achaean name for the town-hall or council-room, = Athen. πρυτανεῖον, Hdt., Plut.

div1.head: ληκέω
div1.sense: Doric λᾱκέω, to sound, Theocr.

div1.head: ληκυθίζω
div1.sense: to adorn rhetorically, amplify, Strab.

div1.head: ληκύθιον
div1.sense: a small oil-flask, Ar.

div1.head: λήκυθος
div1.sense: an oil-flask, oil-bottle, Od., Ar.: a casket for unguents, Ar.
in pl. tropes, tragic phrases, Lat. ampullae, Cicero.

div1.head: ληκυθουργός
div1.sense: making oil-flasks, Plut.

div1.head: λῆμα
div1.sense: will, desire, resolve, purpose, mind, Aesch., Eur.
temper of mind, spirit, whether,
good, courage, resolution, Hdt., Pind., Attic; or,
bad, insolence, arrogance, audacity, Soph.

div1.head: ληματιάω
div1.sense: to be high-spirited, resolute, Ar.

div1.head: λημάω
div1.sense: to be blear-eyed or purblind, λημᾶν κολοκύνταις to have oneʼs eyes running pumpkins, Ar.: metaph., λημᾶν τὰς φρένας Ar.

div1.head: λήμη
div1.sense: a humour that gathers in the corner of the eye, gum, rheum:—metaph., Pericles called Aegina ἡ τοῦ Πειραιέως λ. the eyesore of Peiraeeus, Arist., Plut.; λῆμαι Κρονικαί old prejudices that dim the eyes, Ar.

div1.head: λῆμμα
div1.sense: anything received, income, Aesch.; λ. καὶ ἀνάλωμα receipt and expense, Plat.: generally, gain, profit, Lat. lucrum, Soph., etc.; παντὸς ἥττων λήμματος unable to resist any temptation of gain, Dem.; often in pl., Dem.

div1.head: Λήμνιος
div1.sense: Lemnian, v. Λῆμνος.

div1.head: λημνίσκος
div1.sense: a woollen fillet or riband, Lat. taenia, Plut., etc.

div1.head: Λημνόθεν
div1.sense: from Lemnos, Pind.

div1.head: Λῆμνος
div1.sense: Lemnos, an island in the Aegaean sea, sacred to Hephaestus, Hom., etc.:—from the volcanic nature of the island, the Λήμνιον πῦρ became proverbial, Soph.

div1.head: Ληναικός
div1.sense: of or belonging to the Λήναια, Anth.

div1.head: ληναῖος
div1.sense: belonging to the wine-press:
epith. of Bacchus as god of the wine-press, Diod.
Λήναια (sc. ἱερά), τά, the Lenaea, an Athenian festival held in the month Ληναιών in honour of Bacchus, at which there were contests of the Comic Poets, Ar.
Λήναιον, ου, τό, the Lenaeum, or place at Athens where the Lenaea were held, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: Ληναιών
div1.sense: Ionic name of the seventh Attic month ὁ, Γαμηλιών, in which the Lenaea were held ( v. Διονύσια) the latter part of Jan. and former of Feb., Hes.

div1.head: Λῆναι
div1.sense: Bacchanals, Theocr.

div1.head: ληνός
div1.sense: like Lat. lacus, alveus, a tub or trough; esp.,
a wine-vat, Theocr.
a trough for watering cattle, Hhymn.

div1.head: λῆνος
div1.sense: Lat. lana, wool, Aesch.

div1.head: ληξιαρχικός
div1.sense: belonging to the ληξίαρχος:—τὸ λ. γραμματεῖον the register of each Athenian deme, Dem.

div1.head: ληξίαρχος
div1.sense: the officer at Athens who entered young citizens on the list of their deme when they came of age.

div1.head: λῆξις
div1.sense: a portion assigned by lot, an allotment, Plat.; cf. λάξις.
as law-term, λ. δίκης or λ. alone, a written complaint lodged with the Archon, as the first step to a lawsuit, Plat., Aeschin.

div1.head: λῆξις2
div1.sense: cessation, Aesch.

div1.head: ληπτέος
div1.sense: to be taken or accepted, Plat.
neut. ληπτέον, one must take hold, Ar.: one must undertake, Xen.; one must take or choose, Xen.
one must take, receive, Xen.

div1.head: ληπτικός
div1.sense: disposed to accept, Arist.

div1.head: ληπτός
div1.sense: to be apprehended, Plat., Anth.

div1.head: ληρέω
div1.sense: to be foolish or silly, speak or act foolishly, Lat. nugari, Soph., Ar.

div1.head: λήρημα
div1.sense: silly talk, nonsense, Plat.

div1.head: λῆρος
div1.sense: silly talk, nonsense, trumpery, Ar.:—of persons, nonsense, a trifler, Plat.; λῆροι λεπτότατοι, of sophists, Ar.; as an exclamation, λῆρος, nonsense! humbug! Ar.

div1.head: λῆρος
div1.sense: a poor trinket, Anth.

div1.head: ληρώδης
div1.sense: frivolous, silly, Plat., Arist.

div1.head: λησίμβροτος
div1.sense: taking men unawares, a thief, Hhymn.

div1.head: λησμοσύνη
div1.sense: forgetfulness, Hes., Soph.

div1.head: λῃστάρχης
div1.sense: a captain of robbers, Plut.

div1.head: λῃστεία
div1.sense: a robberʼs life, robbery, piracy, buccaneering, Lat. latrocinium, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: λῃστεύω
div1.sense: to be a robber: to carry on a piratical war, to practise piracy, Lat. latrocinari, Dem.
c. acc. to spoil, plunder, Thuc.

div1.head: λῃστήριον
div1.sense: a band of robbers, Xen., Aeschin.:— a retreat or nest of robbers, Strab.
robbery, in pl., Luc.

div1.head: λῃστής
div1.sense: a robber, plunderer, Soph., Eur., Xen.; esp. by sea, a pirate, rover, buccaneer, Hdt., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: λῃστικός
div1.sense: inclined to rob, piratical, buccaneering, Thuc., Dem.:— τὸ λῃστικόν piracy, Thuc.; also a band of robbers, Thuc.
adv. -κῶς, in the manner of pirates; comp. -κώτερον, Thuc.

div1.head: λῆστις
div1.sense: λῆστιν ἴσχειν ἐπιλανθάνεσθαι, to forget, Soph.

div1.head: λῃστοκτόνος
div1.sense: slaying robbers, Anth.

div1.head: λῃστρικός
div1.sense: piratical, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: λῃστρίς
div1.sense: ναῦς λ. a pirate vessel, Dem., etc.

div1.head: Λητογενής
div1.sense: born of Leto, epith. of Apollo and Artemis, Eur.: pecul. fem. Λατογένεια, Aesch.

div1.head: Λητοΐδης
div1.sense: son of Leto, i. e. Apollo, Hhymn., Hes.

div1.head: Λητῷος
div1.sense: of or born from Leto, Soph.; Doric Λατῴα, Anth.: fem. also Λητωίς, ίδος, Anth.

div1.head: Λητώ
div1.sense: Leto, Lat. Latona, mother of Apollo and Artemis, Hom.

div1.head: λῆψις
div1.sense: a taking hold, seizing, catching, seizure, Thuc.
an accepting, receiving, Plat.; in pl. receipts, Plat.

div1.head: λιάζομαι
div1.sense: Epic Dep to bend, incline:

mostly of persons, to go aside, withdraw, recoil, shrink back, Il.; δεῦρο λιάσθης hither has thou retired, Il.; παρὰ κληῖδα λιάσθη, of a vision, slipped away by the key-hole, Od.; ἐλιάσθην πρός σε I came away to thee, Eur.
to sink, fall, πρηνὴς ἐλιάσθη, λιαζόμενος προτὶ γαίῃ Il.
of things, λιάζετο κῦμα retired, drew back, Il.; πτερὰ λίασθεν (for ἐλιάσθησαν) the dying birdʼs wings dropped, Il.

div1.head: λίαν
div1.sense: very, exceedingly, Hom.; οὐδέ τι λ. οὕτω not so very much, Od.; with a Verb, very much, overmuch, exceedingly, Hom.; strengthd. καὶ λίην, as, aye truly, verily, Hom.; λίην πιστεύειν to believe implicitly, Hdt.; κόμπος λίαν εἰρημένος verily, truly, Aesch.; ἡ λίαν φιλότης his too great love, Aesch.

div1.head: λιαρός
div1.sense: warm, Hom.; οὖρος λ. a warm soft wind, Od.; ὕπνος λ. balmy sleep, Il.

div1.head: λιβάδιον
div1.sense: a small stream, Strab.

div1.head: λιβάζω
div1.sense: =λείβω, to let fall in drops:— Mid. to run out in drops, trickle, Anth.

div1.head: λίβανος
div1.sense: the frankincense-tree, producing λιβανωτός, Hdt., etc.
= λιβανωτός, in which sense it is fem., Eur., etc.

div1.head: λιβανόχροος
div1.sense: frankincense coloured, Strab.

div1.head: λιβανωτίζω
div1.sense: to fumigate with frankincense, Strab.

div1.head: λιβανωτός
div1.sense: frankincense, the gum of the tree λίβανος, Hdt., Ar., etc.
a censer, Lat. thuribulum, NTest.

div1.head: λιβανωτοφόρος
div1.sense: bearing frankincense, Hdt.

div1.head: λιβάς
div1.sense: anything that drops or trickles, a spring, stream, Soph., Eur.: standing water, Babr.: —in pl. streams, pools, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: λιβερτῖνος
div1.sense: the Lat. libertinus, a freedman, NTest.

div1.head: λίβος
div1.sense: = λιβάς: λ. αἵματος a drop or fleck of blood, Aesch.: pl. λίβη tears, Aesch.

div1.head: λιβρός
div1.sense: dripping, wet, Anth.

div1.head: Λιβύηθε
div1.sense: from Libya, Theocr.

div1.head: Λιβύη
div1.sense: Libya, the north part of Africa west of Egypt, Od., Hdt.; in later writers also for the whole Continent

div1.head: Λιβυκός
div1.sense: Libyan, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: Λιβυρνικός
div1.sense: Liburnian; Λιβυρνικόν (sc. πλοῖον) , a light vessel like a galley or felucca, such as was used by the Λιβυρνοί, Plut.; also Λιβυρνίς, ίδος, sc. ναῦς, Plut.

div1.head: Λιβυρνοί
div1.sense: the Liburnians, a people on the Adriatic below Istria, Strab.

div1.head: Λίβυς
div1.sense: a Libyan, Hdt., etc.; and as adj. = Λιβυκός, Eur.; fem. Λίβυσσα, Pind.; also Λιβυστικός, ή, όν, Aesch.

div1.head: Λιβυφοῖνιξ
div1.sense: a Liby-Phoenician, i. e. Carthaginian, Polyb.

div1.head: λιγαίνω
div1.etym: poetic verb, only in pres. and imperf.
div1.sense: to cry aloud, of heralds, Il.; of mourners, Aesch.; also, σύριγγι λ. to produce clear sounds on the pipe, to play on it, Anth.; c. acc. cogn., μέλος λ. Bion, Mosch.
trans. to sing of, Anth.

div1.head: λίγα
div1.sense: in loud clear tone, Hom.

div1.head: λίγγω
div1.sense: only in Epic aor1, λίγξε βιός the bow twanged, Il.

div1.head: λίγδην
div1.sense: just scraping, grazing, Lat. strictim, Od.

div1.head: λιγνύς
div1.sense: thick smoke mixed with flame, a murky flame, Aesch., Soph., Ar.; λιγνὺς πρόσεδρος in Soph. is the smoky flame hanging round Hercules.

div1.head: Λιγυαστάδης
div1.sense: a name borne by Mimnermus, Solon.

div1.head: λιγυηχής
div1.sense: clear-sounding, κιθάρη Anth.

div1.head: λιγύμολπος
div1.sense: clear-singing, Hhymn.

div1.head: λιγύμυθος
div1.sense: clear-speaking, Anth.

div1.head: λιγυπνείων
div1.sense: shrill-blowing, whistling, Od.

div1.head: λιγυπτέρυγος
div1.sense: chirping with the wings, of the cicada, Anth.

div1.head: λιγυρός
div1.sense: clear, whistling, of winds, Il.; of a whip, Il.; λιγυρὰ ἄχεα griefs which vent themselves in shrill wailings, Eur.:—also clear-voiced, sweet-toned, Hom., etc.:—neut. pl. as adv., λιγυρὰ ἀείδειν Theogn.; λιγυρῶς Theocr.
pliant, flexible, of dogsʼ tails, Xen.

div1.head: λιγύς
div1.sense: clear, whistling, of winds, Hom.: of a clear, sweet sound, clear-toned, Hom.; of the nightingale, Aesch.
adv. shrilly, Hom.; clearly, Il.:—neut. as adv., λιγὺ μέλπεσθαι Hes., Aesch.

div1.head: Λίγυς
div1.sense: a Ligurian, Hdt., Thuc., etc.:— adj. Λιγυστικός, ή, όν Ligurian, Strab.

div1.head: λιγύφθογγος
div1.sense: clear-voiced, of heralds, Hom.; of the nightingale, Ar.

div1.head: λιγύφωνος
div1.sense: clear-voiced, loud-voiced, screaming, Il.; also of sweet sounds, Hes., Theocr.

div1.head: λιθάζω
div1.sense: to fling stones, Strab.
trans. to stone a man, NTest.

div1.head: λίθαξ
div1.sense: stony, Od.
as fem. Subst., = λίθος, a grave-stone, Anth.; of the pumice-stone, Anth.

div1.head: λιθάς
div1.sense: collectively in sg., a shower of stones, Aesch.

div1.head: λιθεία
div1.sense: a sort of fine stone or marble for building, Strab.
a precious stone, Strab.

div1.head: λίθεος
div1.sense: of stone, Hom.

div1.head: λιθηλογής
div1.sense: built of stones, Anth.

div1.head: λιθιάω
div1.sense: to suffer from stone, Plat.

div1.head: λιθίδιον
div1.sense: a pebble, Plat.

div1.head: λίθινος
div1.sense: of stone, Hdt., Plat., etc.; λ. θάνατος stony death, caused by seeing the Gorgonʼs head, Pind.; στῆναι λίθινος, of a statue, Hdt.

div1.head: λιθόβλητος
div1.sense: stone-throwing, pelting, Anth.
set with stones, Anth.

div1.head: λιθοβολέω
div1.sense: to pelt with stones, stone, NTest.

div1.head: λιθόβολος
div1.sense: proparox. λιθόβολος, ον, pass. struck with stones, stoned, Eur.

div1.head: λιθοβόλος
div1.sense: throwing stones, pelting with stones: λιθοβόλοι, οἱ, stone-throwers, Thuc., etc.
λιθοβόλος, an engine for hurling stones, Polyb., etc.

div1.head: λιθογλύφος
div1.sense: a sculptor, Luc.

div1.head: λιθοδερκής
div1.sense: petrifying with a glance, Anth.

div1.head: λιθόδμητος
div1.sense: stone-built, Anth.

div1.head: λιθοδόμος
div1.sense: building with stones, a mason, Xen.

div1.head: λιθοεργός
div1.sense: turning to stone, Anth.

div1.head: λιθοκόλλητος
div1.sense: set with precious stones, Theophr., Plut.:— λ. στόμιον a bit set with stones (to make it sharper), Soph.
τὸ λ. inlaid work, mosaic, Strab.

div1.head: λιθοκόπος
div1.sense: a stone-cutter, Dem.

div1.head: λιθοκτονία
div1.sense: death by stoning, Anth.

div1.head: λιθόλευστος
div1.sense: stoned with stones: λ. Ἄρης death by stoning, Soph.

div1.head: λιθολόγημα
div1.sense: a stone-building, Xen.

div1.head: λιθολόγος
div1.sense: one who builds with stones picked out to fit their places, not cut square; then, generally = λιθοδόμος, a mason, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: λιθοξόος
div1.sense: a stone or marble-mason, Anth., Luc.

div1.head: λιθοποιός
div1.sense: turning to stone, Luc.

div1.head: λιθόρρινος
div1.sense: with stony skin, Hhymn.

div1.head: λιθοσπαδής
div1.sense: a chasm made by tearing out stones, Soph.

div1.head: λίθος
div1.sense: a stone, Hom., etc.: a precious stone, Hdt.: marble, Hdt.:—proverb., λίθον ἕψειν to boil a stone, i. e. "to lose oneʼs labour," Ar.;— of stupidity, λίθοι blocks, stones, Ar.
stone as a substance, opp. to wood, flesh, etc, Il., etc.
also fem., Hom., Theocr.;—but the fem. was mostly used of some special stone, as the magnet, Eur., Plat.; of a touchstone, Plat.; ἡ διαφανὴς λ. a piece of crystal used for a burning glass, Ar.
at Athens, λίθος (masc.) was a name for various blocks of stone used for rostra or tribunes, as,
the Bema of the Pnyx, Ar.
another in the ἀγορά used by the κήρυκες, Plut.
an altar in the ἀγορά, Dem.
a piece on a draughtboard, Theocr.

div1.head: λιθόστρωτος
div1.sense: paved with stones, Soph.:— λιθόστρωτον, τό, a tesselated pavement, NTest.

div1.head: λιθοτομία
div1.sense: a place where stone is cut, a quarry; mostly in pl., quarries, Hdt., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: λιθοτόμος
div1.sense: a stone-cutter, Xen.

div1.head: λιθουργέω
div1.sense: to turn into stone, petrify, Anth.

div1.head: λιθουργός
div1.sense: a worker in stone, stone-mason, Ar., Thuc.
as adj., σιδήρια λιθουργά a stonemasonʼs tools, Thuc.

div1.head: λιθοφορέω
div1.sense: to carry stones, Thuc.

div1.head: λιθοφόρος
div1.sense: carrying stones:—as Subst., = λιθοβόλος, Polyb.

div1.head: λιθώδης
div1.sense: like stone, stony, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: λικμαῖος
div1.sense: presiding over winnowing, Anth.

div1.head: λικμάω
div1.sense: to part the grain from the chaff, to winnow, Il., Xen.:— metaph. to scatter like chaff, NTest.

div1.head: λικμητήρ
div1.sense: a winnower of corn, Il.

div1.head: λικμητός
div1.sense: a winnowing, Anth.

div1.head: λίκνον
div1.sense: a winnowing-fan, i. e. a broad basket, in which the corn was placed after threshing, and then thrown against the wind:—it was sacred to Bacchus, cf. Virgilʼs mystica vannus Iacchi, Soph., Anth.
the infant Bacchus was carried in it: hence a cradle, Hhymn., etc.

div1.head: λικνοφόρος
div1.sense: carrying the sacred λίκνον in procession, Dem.

div1.head: λικριφίς
div1.sense: crosswise, sideways, Hom.; cf. λέχριος

div1.head: λιλαίομαι
div1.etym: Mid., only in pres. and imperf.
div1.sense: to long or desire earnestly, Il.; metaph. of a lance, λιλαιομένη χροὸς ἆσαι longing to taste flesh, Il.; λιλαιομένη πόσιν εἶναι longing for him to be her husband, Od.: —also c. gen. to long for, λιλαιόμενοι πολέμοιο Il., etc.:—also, φόωσδε λιλαίεσθαι to struggle to the light of day, Od.

div1.head: λιμαίνω
div1.sense: to suffer from hunger, Hdt.

div1.head: λιμενίτης
div1.sense: god of the harbour, Anth.: fem. λιμενῖτις, ιδος, Anth.

div1.head: λιμενορμίτης
div1.sense: tarrying in the harbour, Anth.

div1.head: λιμενοσκόπος
div1.sense: watching the harbour, Anth.

div1.head: λιμήν
div1.sense: a harbour, haven, creek, whereas ὅρμος is properly the inner part of the harbour, the landing-place, Hom., etc.; in pl., Od., Soph., etc.; —also c. gen. objecti, λιμένες θαλάσσης havens of refuge from the sea, Od.
metaph. a haven, retreat, refuge, Theogn.; ἑταιρείας λ. a haven of friendship, Soph.; λ. τῶν ἐμῶν βουλευμάτων Eur.; c. gen. objecti, χείματος λ. a harbour of refuge from the storm, Eur.

a place of resort, receptacle, πλούτου λ. Aesch.; παντὸς οἰωνοῦ λ. Soph.; in O. T. 420, the sense seems to be—how will Cithaeron not be filled with thy cries (λιμὴν ἔσται τῆς σῆς βοῆς) ? how will it not re-echo them?

div1.head: λιμηρός
div1.sense: hungry, causing hunger, Theocr., Anth.

div1.head: λιμηρός2
div1.sense: furnished with a good harbour, Thuc.

div1.head: λιμναῖος
div1.sense: of or from the marsh or mere, ὄρνιθας χερσαίους τε καὶ λ. both land-fowl and water fowl, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: λιμνάς
div1.etym: poet. fem. of λιμναῖος, Theocr., Babr.

div1.head: λίμνη
div1.sense: a pool of standing water left by the sea or a river, Il.: then, a marshy lake, mere, Lat. palus, Il., Hdt., Attic:—also, a large pool or basin (artificial), Hdt.
in Hom. and other Poets, the sea.
Λίμναι, ῶν, αἱ, a quarter of Athens (once prob. marshy), near the Acropolis, in which stood the Lenaeum, Ar., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: Λιμνήσιος
div1.sense: laker, name of a frog, Batr.

div1.head: λιμνήτης
div1.sense: living in marshes, Theocr.
epith. of Artemis, dat. Λιμνᾶτι shortd. for Λιμνάτιδι, Anth.

div1.head: λιμνουργός
div1.sense: one who works in λίμναι, a fisherman, Plut.

div1.head: λιμνοφυής
div1.sense: marsh-born, Anth.

div1.head: λιμνόχαρις
div1.sense: grace of the marsh, or -χαρής, love-marsh, name of a frog, Batr.

div1.head: λιμνώδης
div1.sense: like a marsh, marshy: τὸ λιμνῶδες τοῦ Στρυμόνος the marshy ground at the mouth of the Strymon, Thuc.

div1.head: λιμοθνής
div1.sense: dying of hunger, Aesch.

div1.head: λιμοκτονέω
div1.sense: to kill by hunger, starve, Plat.

div1.head: λιμοκτονία
div1.sense: a killing by hunger or by abstinence from food, Plat.

div1.head: λιμός
div1.sense: hunger, famine, Hom., etc.:— proverb., ἀπολεῖτε λιμῷ Μηλίῳ, referring to the siege of Melos, Ar.:—metaph., of the mind, Eur.

div1.head: λιμοφορεύς
div1.sense: causing hunger, Anth.

div1.head: λιμόψωρος
div1.sense: a cutaneous disease, scurvy, Polyb.

div1.head: λιμώσσω
div1.sense: to be famished, hungry, Strab., Anth.

div1.head: λίνεος
div1.sense: of flax, flaxen, linen, Lat. lineus, Hdt., Plat., etc.

div1.head: λινόδετος
div1.sense: bound with flaxen cords, Eur.; λινόδετος τοῦ ποδός tied by the foot, Ar.

div1.head: λινοθήρας
div1.sense: one who uses nets, Anth.

div1.head: λινοθώρηξ
div1.sense: wearing a linen cuirass, Il., Xen.

div1.head: λινόκλωστος
div1.sense: spinning flax, Anth.

div1.head: λινόκροκος
div1.sense: flax-woven, Eur.

div1.head: λίνον
div1.sense: anything made of flax:

a cord, fishing-line, Il.: the thread spun from a distaff, Eur., etc.; and in pl., Eur.:—metaph. the thread of destiny spun by the Fates, Hom., Theocr.:—proverb., λίνον λίνῳ συνάπτειν, i. e. to join like with like, to deal with matters of like kind, Plat.
a fishing-net, Il.:— a hunting-net, Theocr.
linen, linen-cloth, Hom.: sail-cloth, Ar.
flax for spinning, Ar.
the plant that produces flax, Lat. linum, Hdt., etc.; λίνου σπέρμα lint-seed, Thuc.
on λίνον ἄειδεν, v. Λίνος II.

div1.head: λινόπεπλος
div1.sense: with linen robe, Anth.

div1.head: λινοπόρος
div1.sense: sail-wafting, Eur.

div1.head: λινοπτάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to watch nets, see whether anything is caught, Ar.

div1.head: λινόπτερος
div1.sense: sail-winged, of ships, Aesch.

div1.head: λινόπτης
div1.sense: one who watches nets to see whether anything is caught, Arist.

div1.head: Λίνος
div1.sense: Linos, a mythical minstrel, son of Apollo and Urania (Calliope), teacher of Orpheus, Theocr., etc.

as appellat., the song or lay of Linos, sung by a boy to the cithara while the vintagers are at work, Λίνον ὑπὸ καλὸν ἄειδεν sang the lovely lay of Linos in accompaniment, Il.:—cf. αἴλινος which is a mournful song.

div1.head: λινοστασία
div1.sense: a laying of nets: the nets laid, Anth.

div1.head: λινουργός
div1.sense: a weaver, Strab.

div1.head: λινοφθόρος
div1.sense: linen-wasting, Aesch.

div1.head: λιπαίνω
div1.sense: to oil, anoint: Mid. to anoint oneself, Anth.
of rivers, to make fat, enrich, Eur.

div1.head: λιπανδρέω
div1.sense: to be in want of men, Strab.; λιπ-ανδρία, want of men, Strab.

div1.head: λίπα
div1.sense: adv. unctuously, richly, ἀλεῖψαι or ἀλείψασθαι λίπʼ ἐλαίῳ to anoint or cause to be anointed richly with oil, Il.; so, χρῖσαι or χρίσασθαι λίπʼ ἐλαίῳ Il.; only once without ἐλαίῳ, λοέσσατο καὶ λίπʼ ἄλειψεν Od. In all these places, the final vowel is uncertain; but we have λίπα ἀλείψασθαι, -εσθαι in Thuc., etc.

div1.head: λιπαράμπυξ
div1.sense: with bright tiara, Pind.

div1.head: Λιπάρα
div1.sense: the largest of the Aeolian islands, Thuc., etc.:—adj. Λιπαραῖος, η, ον of Lipara, αἱ Λ. νῆσοι the group of these islands, Polyb.

div1.head: λιπαρέω
div1.sense: to persist, persevere, hold out, Hdt.; so in part., διάγειν λιπαρέοντας to continue to hold out, Hdt.; also, reversely, λιπαρέετε μένοντες persist in holding your ground, Hdt.; so, c. dat., λ. τῇ πόσει to keep on drinking, Hdt.
of persistent entreaty,
absol. to persist in intreating, to be importunate, Hdt., Aesch., etc.
c. acc. et inf. to importune one to do a thing, Aesch., Soph.
c. acc., λιπαρεῖν αὐτόν entreat earnestly for him, Dem.

div1.head: λιπαρής
div1.sense: persisting or persevering in a thing, earnest, indefatigable, Plat.
of things, Ar., Luc.
earnest in begging or praying, importunate, λ. χείρ a hand instant in prayer, Soph.:— τὸ λιπαρές importunity, Luc.; πρὸς τὸ λ. λιπαρῶς, Soph.
adv. -ρῶς, earnestly, importunately, Plat.
div1.etym: Deriv. uncertain: the first syll. seems to be from λι-, λίαν.

div1.head: λιπαρητέος
div1.sense: one must be importunate, Xen.

div1.head: λιπαρία
div1.sense: importunity, persistence, Hdt.

div1.head: λιπαρόζωνος
div1.sense: bright-girdled, Eur.

div1.head: λιπαρόθρονος
div1.sense: bright-throned, Aesch.

div1.head: λιπαροκρήδεμνος
div1.sense: with bright head-band, Il.

div1.head: λιπαροπλόκαμος
div1.sense: with glossy locks, Il.

div1.head: λιπαρός
div1.sense: oily, shiny with oil, acc. to the custom of oiling the skin in the palaestra, Od., Ar., etc.
oily, greasy, Ar.
of the skin, shining, sleek, Lat. nitidus, λιπαροὶ πόδες bright, smooth feet, without a wrinkle, Il.; λιπαρώτεροι ἐγένοντο Hdt.; λ. στῆθος Ar., etc.
of condition, rich, comfortable, easy, Lat. nitidus, lautus, Od., Pind.; so, λιπαρῶς γηράσκειν Od.
of things, bright, brilliant, costly, splendid, Hom.
of soil, fat, rich, fruitful, Lat. pinguis, Hhymn., Theogn.; λιπαραὶ Ἀθῆναι, a favourite epith. with the Athenians, prob. with allusion to the Attic olive, Pind., Ar.

div1.head: λιπαρόχροος
div1.sense: with shining skin, Theocr.

div1.head: λιπαυγής
div1.sense: deserted by light, blind, Anth.

div1.head: λιπάω
div1.sense: to be fat and sleek, Epic part. λιπόων Anth.

div1.head: λιπερνής
div1.sense: desolate, forlorn, homeless, outcast, Archil.

div1.head: λιπόγαμος
div1.sense: having abandoned her marriage ties, of Helen, Eur.

div1.head: λιπόγυιος
div1.sense: wanting a limb, maimed, Anth.

div1.head: λιπομαρτύριον
div1.sense: λιπο-μαρτυρίου δίκη, an action against a witness for non-appearance, Dem.

div1.head: λιπομήτωρ
div1.sense: motherless, Anth.

div1.head: λιπόναυς
div1.sense: deserting the fleet, Aesch.

div1.head: λιποναύτης
div1.sense: leaving the sailors, Theocr.

div1.head: λιπόπατρις
div1.sense: causing to forget oneʼs country, of the lotos, Anth.

div1.head: λιποπάτωρ
div1.sense: deserter of oneʼs father, Eur.

div1.head: λιπόπνοος
div1.sense: left by breath, breathless, dead, Anth.

div1.head: λιποσαρκής
div1.sense: wanting flesh, Anth.

div1.head: λίπος
div1.sense: fat, βεβρῶτες αἵματος λίπος gorged with fat and blood, Soph.

div1.head: λιποστέφανος
div1.sense: falling from the wreath, Anth.

div1.head: λιποστρατία
div1.sense: desertion of the army, refusal to serve, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: λιποταξία
div1.sense: a leaving oneʼs post, desertion, Dem.

div1.head: λιποτάξιον
div1.sense: λιπο-ταξίου γραφή, ἡ, an indictment for desertion, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: λιποτριχής
div1.sense: having lost oneʼs hair, Anth.

div1.head: λιποψυχέω
div1.sense: to leave life, swoon, Thuc., Xen.
to lack spirit, fail in courage, Hdt.

div1.head: λίπτομαι
div1.sense: Dep., with perf. pass. λέλιμμαι, to be eager, Aesch.:—c. gen. to be eager for, long for, Aesch.

div1.head: λίς
div1.sense: a lion, Il., Hes., Theocr.

div1.head: λίς2
div1.sense: smooth, Od.
as masc. Subst., only in dat. λιτί and acc. λῖτα, smooth cloth, linen cloth: others take λῖτα to be acc. pl. neut. linen cloths:—in Anth., we have λίτα [ῐ] πολυδαίδαλα, embroidered stuffs.

div1.head: λίσπος
div1.sense: smooth, polished, Ar.
as Subst. λίσπαι, ῶν, αἱ, dice cut in two by friends (ξένοι) , each of whom kept half as tallies (σύμβολα) , Plat.

div1.head: λισσάς
div1.sense: smooth, bare, Eur., Theocr.
as Subst. a bare, smooth cliff, Plut.

div1.head: λίσσομαι
div1.sense: to beg, pray, entreat, beseech, either absol. or c. acc. pers., Hom.; that by which one prays, in gen., λ. τινα γούνων Il.; λ. Ζηνός Od.:—an inf. is often added, οὐδέ σʼ ἔγωγε λίσσομαι μένειν I do not pray thee to remain, Il.
c. acc. rei, to beg or pray for, οἷ αὐτῶι θάνατον λιτέσθαι Il.: c. dupl. acc. pers. et rei, ταῦτα μὲν οὐχ ὑμέας ἔτι λίσσομαι this I beg of you no more, Od.

div1.head: λισσός
div1.sense: smooth, λισσὴ αἰπεῖά τε εἰς ἅλα πέτρη a smooth rock running sheer into the sea, Od.; λισσὴ δʼ ἀναδέδρομε πέτρη Od.

div1.head: λιστός
div1.sense: to be moved by prayer, ap. Plat.

div1.head: λιστρεύω
div1.sense: to dig round a plant, Od.

div1.head: λίστρον
div1.sense: a tool for levelling or smoothing, a spade, a kind of shovel, Od., Mosch.

div1.head: λιτανεύω
div1.sense: to pray, entreat, esp. for protection, either absol. or c. acc. pers., Hom.; that by which one prays in gen., γούνων λιτανεύειν Od.; also, γούνων ἁψάμενοι λιτανεύσομεν (Epic for -wmen) , Il.; c. inf., Il.

div1.head: λιτανός
div1.sense: praying, suppliant, μέλη Aesch.: —as Subst., λιτανά, τά, λιταί, ἀμφὶ λιτανὰ ἔχεσθαι to be engaged in prayer, Aesch.

div1.head: λιταργίζω
div1.sense: to slip away, Ar.

div1.head: λιτή
div1.sense: a prayer, entreaty, mostly in pl., Od., Hdt., Trag.
Λιταί, Prayers of sorrow and repentance, personified in Il. 9. 502 sq.

div1.head: λιτόβιος
div1.sense: living plainly or sparingly, Strab.

div1.head: λιτός
div1.sense: suppliant, supplicatory, Pind.

div1.head: λιτός
div1.sense: smooth, plain: of style, simple, unadorned, Arist.: of persons, simple, frugal, Polyb.: adv. λιτῶς, Anth.
paltry, petty, Anth.

div1.head: λιτότης
div1.sense: plainness, simplicity, Plut.

div1.head: λιτραῖος
div1.sense: weighing or worth a λίτρα, Anth.

div1.head: λίτρα
div1.sense: a silver coin of Sicily, Lat. libra:—as a weight, 12 ounces, a pound, Anth.:—metaph., λίτραν ἐτῶν ζήσας having lived a pound of years, i. e. 72 (for a pound of gold was coined into 72 pieces), Anth.

div1.head: λίτρον
div1.etym: older form for νίτρον, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: Λιτυέρσης
div1.sense: Lityerses, a son of Midas: a reaperʼs song named after him, Theocr.

div1.head: λίτυον
div1.sense: the Roman lituus, Plut.
